hadiths.arabic: 3813. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أكثَرُ مَصارِعِ العُقولِ تحتَ بُرُوقِ المَطامِعِ
hadiths.english: 3813. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The intellects are most often destroyed as a result of their subservience to bursts of avid desires.’

hadiths.arabic: 3814. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا يَجتَمِعُ الوَرَعُ والطَّمَعُ
hadiths.english: 3814. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Piety and greed can never come together.’

hadiths.arabic: 3815. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : بِئسَ العَبدُ عَبدٌ لَهُ طَمَعٌ يَقودُهُ
hadiths.english: 3815. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘How wretched the servant who is a slave of his own greed, which controls him.’

hadiths.arabic: 3816. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام - لهشامٍ وهُو يَعِظُهُ - : إيّاكَ والطَّمَعَ، وعلَيكَ باليَأسِ مِمّا في أيدِي الناسِ، وأمِتِ الطَّمَعَ مِن المَخلوقِينَ؛ فإنَّ الطَّمَعَ مِفتاحٌ لِلذُّلِّ، واختِلاسُ العَقلِ، واختِلاقُ المُرُوّاتِ، وتَدنِيسُ العِرضِ، والذَّهابُ بِالعِلمِ
hadiths.english: 3816. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said to Hashim, exhorting him, ‘You must beware of greed, and despair of acquiring anything in the possession of others. Suppress the greed in others for verily greed is the key to disgrace, it exploits the intellect, fabricates valorous qualities for itself, tarnishes one’s reputation, and does away with one’s knowledge.’

hadiths.arabic: 3817. الإمامُ الهاديُّ عليه السلام : الطَّمَعُ سَجِيَّةٌ سَيِّئَةٌ.
hadiths.english: 3817. Imam al-Hadi (AS) said, ‘Greed is an evil characteristic.’

hadiths.arabic: 3818. الإمامُ العسكريُّ عليه السلام : ما أقبَحَ بالمُؤمِنِ أن تكونَ لَهُ رَغبَةٌ تُذِلُّهُ
hadiths.english: 3818. Imam al-Askari (AS) said, ‘How revolting it is for the believer to have an avid desire that disgraces him.’

hadiths.arabic: 3819. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام - في الدعاءِ - : إذا رَأيتُ مَولايَ ذُنُوبي فَزِعتُ، وإذا رَأيتُ عَفوَكَ طَمِعتُ
hadiths.english: 3819. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said in one of his supplications, ‘When I consider my sins my Lord, I am horrified [at them], and when I consider Your pardon, I am avidly eager [for it].’

hadiths.arabic: 3820. الإمامُ زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام - أيضاً - : فإنّما أسألُكَ لِقَديمِ الرَّجاءِ فيكَ، وعَظيمِ الطَّمَعِ منكَ؛ الذي أوجَبتَهُ على‏ نفسِكَ مِن الرَّأفَةِ والرَّحمَةِ
hadiths.english: 3820. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said in another one of his supplications, ‘For indeed I ask You because of my eternal hope in You and because of the great desire that I entertain about You; which is the graciousness and mercy that You have made obligatory upon Yourself.’

hadiths.arabic: 3821. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الطَّهُورُ شَطرُ الإيمانِ
hadiths.english: 3821. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Purification is a portion of faith.’

hadiths.arabic: 3822. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أوَّلُ مايُحاسَبُ بهِ العَبدُ طَهُورُهُ
hadiths.english: 3822. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘The first thing that the servant will have to account for is his ritual purification.’

hadiths.arabic: 3823. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا تُقبَلُ صَلاةٌ بغَيرِ طَهورٍ
hadiths.english: 3823. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘A prayer without ablution is not accepted.’

hadiths.arabic: 3824. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : خَلَقَ اللَّهُ الماءَ طَهوراً لا يُنَجِّسُهُ شَي‏ءٌ، إلّا ما غَيَّرَ لَونَهُ أو طَعمَهُ أو رِيحَهُ
hadiths.english: 3824. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Allah has created water to be a purifier where nothing can make it impure, except for that water whose colour, taste or smell has changed.’

hadiths.arabic: 3825. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : كُلُّ ما أشرَقَت علَيهِ الشَّمسُ فهُو طاهِرٌ
hadiths.english: 3825. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘Everything that the sun shines on becomes purified.’

hadiths.arabic: 3826. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ اللَّهَ عَزَّوجلَّ جَعَلَ التُّرابَ طَهوراً كما جَعَلَ الماءَ طَهوراً
hadiths.english: 3826. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Verily Allah, Mighty and Exalted, made the earth a purifier just as he made water a purifier.’

hadiths.arabic: 3827. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام - لمّا سُئلَ عنِ الجِصِّ يُوقَدُ عَلَيهِ بِالعذَرَةِ وعِظامِ المَوتى‏ ثُمَّ يُجَصَّصُ بِهِ المَسجِدُ ، أيُسجَدُ عَلَيهِ ؟ - : إنَّ الماءَ وَالنّارَ قَد طَهَّراهُ
hadiths.english: 3827. Imam al-Kazim (AS) was once asked about gypsum that is burnt along with dried excrement and bone ash, and then used to plaster a mosque, and whether prostration on such plaster is allowed. He replied, ‘Verily water and fire [from the kilning process] have purified it.’

hadiths.arabic: 3828. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : فَرَضَ اللَّهُ الإيمانَ تَطهيراً مِن الشِّركِ
hadiths.english: 3828. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Allah has obligated faith in order to purify one from polytheism.’

hadiths.arabic: 3829. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنَّ تَقوَى اللَّهِ دَواءُ داءِ قُلوبِكُم وطَهُورُ دَنَسِ أنفُسِكُم
hadiths.english: 3829. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Verily being wary of one’s duty to Allah is the remedy for the disease of your hearts … and the purifier of the pollution in your souls.’

hadiths.arabic: 3830. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إن كُنتُم لا مَحالَةَ مُتَطَهِّرِينَ فَتَطَهَّرُوا مِن دَنَسِ العُيوبِ والذُّنوبِ
hadiths.english: 3830. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Since you have no choice but to purify your bodies, then make a point of purifying yourselves of your faults and your sins.’

sections.section_title_en: OBEDIENCE TO ALLAH AND ITS EFFECTS

hadiths.arabic: 3831. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّهُ لا يُدرَكُ ما عِندَ اللَّهِ إلّا بطاعَتِهِ
hadiths.english: 3831. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Verily what is with Allah can only ever be attained through His obedience.’

hadiths.arabic: 3832. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : طاعَةُ اللَّهِ مِفتاحُ كُلِّ سَدادٍ، وصَلاحُ كُلِّ فَسادٍ
hadiths.english: 3832. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Obedience to Allah is the key to every efficient matter and the redressing of every immoral act.’

hadiths.arabic: 3833. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أجدَرُ الناسِ برَحمَةِ اللَّهِ أقوَمُهُم بالطّاعَةِ
hadiths.english: 3833. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The person most worthy of Allah’s mercy is the one most diligent in Allah’s obedience.’

hadiths.arabic: 3834. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : علَيكُم بطاعَةِ مَن لا تُعذَرُونَ بجَهالَتِهِ
hadiths.english: 3834. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘It is incumbent upon you to obey the One whom you hold no excuse to remain ignorant of.’

hadiths.arabic: 3835. الإمامُ الهاديُّ عليه السلام : مَن أطاعَ الخالِقَ لَم يُبالِ بسَخَطِ المَخلوقِ
hadiths.english: 3835. Imam al-Hadi (AS) said, ‘He who obeys the Creator is not bothered by the displeasure of the creation [i.e. other people].’

sections.section_title_en: HE WHO IS ENTITLED TO BE OBEYED

hadiths.arabic: 3836. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أطِعِ العاقِلَ تَغنَمْ، اِعْصِ الجاهِلَ تَسلَمْ
hadiths.english: 3836. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Obey the intelligent man and you will gain, and disobey the ignorant man and you will remain safe.’

hadiths.arabic: 3837. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أطِعِ العِلمَ واعْصِ الجَهلَ تُفلِحْ
hadiths.english: 3837. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Obey knowledge and disobey ignorance and you will prosper.’

hadiths.arabic: 3838. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا دِينَ لمَن دانَ بطاعَةِ المَخلوقِ ومَعصيَةِ الخالِقِ
hadiths.english: 3838. 3843. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The religion of one who adheres to obeying creatures and disobeying the Creator does not count.’

hadiths.arabic: 3839. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أطِعْ مَن فَوقَكَ يُطِعْكَ مَن دُونَكَ
hadiths.english: 3839. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Obey one who is above you [in authority] and the one below you will obey you.’

hadiths.arabic: 3840. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن تَواضَعَ قَلبُهُ للَّهِ‏ِ لَم يَسأمْ بَدَنُهُ مِن طاعَةِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 3840. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He whose heart submits to Allah, his body never tires of Allah’s obedience.’

hadiths.arabic: 3841. الإمامُ الهاديُّ عليه السلام : مَن جَمَعَ لَكَ وُدَّهُ ورَأيَهُ فَاجمَعْ لَهُ طاعَتَكَ
hadiths.english: 3841. Imam al-Hadi (AS) said, ‘He who gives you both his affection and his good opinion is entitled to your giving him your obedience.’

sections.section_title_en: HE WHO MUST NOT BE OBEYED

hadiths.arabic: 3842. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن أرضى‏ سُلطاناً بما يُسخِطُ اللَّهَ خَرَجَ عن دِينِ اللَّهِ عَزَّوجلَّ
hadiths.english: 3842. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘He who pleases a ruler with regard to something that displeases Allah excludes himself from the religion of Allah, Mighty and Exalted.’

hadiths.arabic: 3843. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ألا فَالحَذَرَ الحَذَرَ مِن طاعَةِ ساداتِكم وكُبَرائكُمُ الَّذينَ تَكَبَّرُوا عن حَسَبِهِم، وتَرَفَّعُوا فَوقَ نَسَبِهِم ولا تُطِيعُوا الأدعِياءَ الذينَ شَرِبتُم بِصَفوِكُم كَدَرَهُم، وخَلَطتُم بِصِحَّتِكُم مَرَضَهُم، وأدخَلتُم في حَقِّكُم باطِلَهُم، وهُم أساسُ الفُسوقِ
hadiths.english: 3843. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Beware O beware of obeying your leaders and your elders who felt proud of their achievements and boasted about their lineage … and do not obey those who claim to be Muslims [but are hypocrites] whose filth you imbibe alongside your propriety, whose ailments you mix with your healthiness, and whose wrongs you have allowed to infiltrate your rightful matters, while they are the very foundation of vice.’

hadiths.arabic: 3844. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن أطاعَ التَّوانِيَ ضَيَّعَ الحُقوقَ، ومَن أطاعَ الواشِيَ ضَيَّعَ الصَّدِيقَ
hadiths.english: 3844. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He who obeys an indifferent person ends up losing his rights, and he who obeys an informant ends up losing his friends.’

hadiths.arabic: 3845. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّ الرِيحَ الطَّيِّبَةَ تَشُدُّ القَلبَ وتَزِيدُ في الجِماعِ
hadiths.english: 3845. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Verily the pleasant fragrance strengthens the heart and acts as an aphrodisiac.’

hadiths.arabic: 3846. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن تَطَيَّبَ للَّهِ‏ِ جاءَ يَومَ القِيامَةِ ورِيحُهُ أطيَبُ مِنَ المِسكِ، ومَن تَطَيَّبَ لِغَيرِ اللَّهِ جاءَ يَومَ القِيامَةِ ورِيحُهُ أنتَنُ مِن الجِيفَةِ
hadiths.english: 3846. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘He who perfumes himself for Allah, most High, will be raised on the Day of Resurrection, smelling more fragrant than sweet musk, whereas he who perfumes himself for other than Allah [for an unlawful purpose] will be raised on the Day of Resurrection smelling more putrid than a corpse.’

hadiths.arabic: 3847. سنن النسائي عن أنس بن مالك : كانَ النبيُّ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله إذا اُتِيَ بِطِيبٍ لَم يَرُدَّهُ
hadiths.english: 3847. Anas b. Malik narrated, ‘The Prophet (SAWA) never used to refuse perfume when he was gifted it.’

hadiths.arabic: 3848. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الطِّيبُ نُشْرَةٌ
hadiths.english: 3848. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Perfume is an amulet [a remedy].’

hadiths.arabic: 3849. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : العِطرُ مِن سُنَنِ المُرسَلِينَ
hadiths.english: 3849. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Putting perfume is a practice of the messengers.’

hadiths.arabic: 3850. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : كانَ رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله يُنفِقُ في الطِّيبِ أكثَرَ مِمّا يُنفِقُ في الطَّعامِ
hadiths.english: 3850. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) narrated, ‘The Prophet (SAWA) used to spend more on perfume than he did on food.’

hadiths.arabic: 3851. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن تَطَيَّبَ أوَّلَ النهارِ لَم يَزَلْ عَقلُهُ مَعهُ إلى اللَّيلِ
hadiths.english: 3851. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Whoever perfumes himself first thing in the morning has his intellect [working] with him till nightfall.’

hadiths.arabic: 3852. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : لا يَنبَغِي للرَّجُلِ أن يَدَعَ الطِّيبَ في كُلِّ يَومٍ، فإن لَم يَقدِرْ علَيهِ فَيَومٌ ويَومٌ لا، فإن لَم يَقدِرْ ففي كُلِّ جُمُعَةٍ و لا يَدَعْ
hadiths.english: 3852. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, ‘Man should not leave one day without perfuming himself, and if he is not able to do that, then he should perfume himself every other day, and if he cannot do that, then he should do so every Friday without fail.’

hadiths.arabic: 3853. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : الطِّيبُ مِن أخلاقِ الأنبياءِ
hadiths.english: 3853. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, ‘Putting perfume is a noble characteristic of the prophets.’

hadiths.arabic: 3854. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : طِيبُ النِّساءِ ما ظَهَرَ لَونُهُ وخَفِيَ رِيحُهُ، وطِيبُ الرِّجالِ ما ظَهَرَ رِيحُهُ وخَفِيَ لَونُهُ
hadiths.english: 3854. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Perfumes suitable for women are those that have a visible colour and a subtle fragrance and perfumes suitable for men have a distinct fragrance and a transparent colour.’

hadiths.arabic: 3855. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أيُّما امرأةٍ استَعطَرَتْ فَمَرَّت على‏ قَومٍ لِيَجِدُوا مِن رِيحِها فهي زانِيَةٌ
hadiths.english: 3855. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Any woman who perfumes herself and goes out among people intending for them to smell her fragrance is an adulteress.’

hadiths.arabic: 3856. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن رَدَّتهُ الطِّيَرَةُ عَن حاجَتِهِ فَقَد أشرَكَ
hadiths.english: 3856. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘He who is driven by an evil omen to abandon fulfilment of his need has indeed associated something with Allah.’

hadiths.arabic: 3857. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن خَرَجَ يُريدُ سَفَراً فَرَجَعَ مِن طَيرٍ فقد كَفَرَ بما اُنزِلَ على‏ محمّدٍ
hadiths.english: 3857. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘He who leaves his home intending to travel, then returns because of an evil omen has indeed disbelieved in what has been revealed to Muhammad.’

hadiths.arabic: 3858. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أصدَقُ الطِّيَرَةِ الفَألُ
hadiths.english: 3858. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘The truest omen is the optimistic auspice.’

hadiths.arabic: 3859. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ليسَ مِنّا مَن تَطَيَّرَ أو تُطُيِّرَ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 3859. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘One who draws evil omens or believes evil omens drawn by others, or predicts the future or has his future predicted for him, or practices magic or has magic practiced for him, is not one of us.’

hadiths.arabic: 3860. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : كَفّارَةُ الطِّيَرَةِ التَّوَكُّلُ
hadiths.english: 3860. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘The penance for taking an evil omen is complete reliance on Allah.’

hadiths.arabic: 3861. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا طِيَرَةَ ولا شُؤمَ
hadiths.english: 3861. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘There is no such thing as an evil omen or bad luck.’

hadiths.arabic: 3862. مكارم الأخلاق : في الحديث: إنّ النبيَّ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله كانَ يُحِبُّ الفَألَ الحَسَنَ ويَكرَهُ الطِّيَرَةَ ، وكانَ يَأمُرُ مَن رَأى‏ شَيئاً يَكرَهُهُ ويَتَطَيَّرُ مِنهُ أن يقولَ : اللّهُمّ لايُؤتِي الخَيرَ إلّا أنتَ، ولا يَدفَعُ السَّيّئاتِ إلّا أنتَ ، ولا حولَ ولاقُوَّةَ إلّا بكَ
hadiths.english: 3862. It is narrated in Makarim al-Akhlaq: ‘Verily the Prophet (SAWA) used to like the optimistic auspice and used to dislike the evil omen. He used to tell people who saw something they disliked and took it to mean an evil omen to say: ‘O Allah, none gives good but You, and none repels evil but You, and there is no power and no strength except with You.’

hadiths.arabic: 3863. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : الطِّيَرَةُ على‏ ما تَجعَلُها إن هَوَّنتَها تَهَوَّنَت، وإن شَدَّدتَها تَشَدَّدَت، وإن لَم تَجعَلْها شَيئاً لَم تَكُن شَيئاً
hadiths.english: 3863. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘The evil omen takes effect according to what you make of it – if you do not take it seriously, it will not be serious, and if you attach great importance to it, it will bear great importance, and if you do not make anything of it, it will not mean anything.’

sections.section_title_en: ENCOURAGING THE CLIPPING OF ONE’S NAILS

hadiths.arabic: 3864. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : تَقليمُ الأظفارِ يَمنَعُ الداءَ الأعظَمَ، و يُدِرُّ الرِّزقَ
hadiths.english: 3864. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Clipping one’s nails prevents the worst disease, and yields abundant sustenance.’

hadiths.arabic: 3865. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : إنّما قَصُّ الأظفارِ لأنّها مَقِيلُ الشَّيطانِ، ومِنهُ يَكونُ النِّسيانُ
hadiths.english: 3865. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘Do cut your nails indeed for verily they are Satan’s resting place, and from him ensues forgetfulness.’

hadiths.arabic: 3866. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ أستَرَ وأخفى‏ ما يُسَلَّطُ الشَّيطانُ مِنِ ابنِ آدَمَ أن صارَ أن يَسكُنَ تَحتَ الأظافِيرِ.
hadiths.english: 3866. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Verily the most hidden and subtle way that Satan has managed to gain control over man is that he has made himself an abode under his nails [i.e. in unclean places].’

sections.section_title_en: ENCOURAGING WOMEN TO LEAVE THEIR NAILS (LONG)

hadiths.arabic: 3867. الكافي : قال رسولُ اللَّهِ - للرِّجالِ - : قُصُّوا أظافِيرَكُم، وللنِّساءِ : اُترُكْنَ فإنّهُ أزيَنُ لَكُنَّ
hadiths.english: 3867. It is narrated in al-Kafi on the authority of al-Sakuni that the Prophet of Allah (AS) said to men, ‘Cut your nails’, and to women, ‘Leave them for verily that is more beautiful for you.’

hadiths.arabic: 3868. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إيّاكُم والظُّلمَ؛ فإنّهُ يُخرِبُ قُلوبَكُم
hadiths.english: 3868. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Beware of wrongdoing for verily it corrupts your hearts.’

hadiths.arabic: 3869. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنّه لَيَأتِيَ العَبدُ يَومَ القِيامَةِ وقد سَرَّتهُ حَسَناتُهُ، فَيَجِي‏ءُ الرجُلُ فيقولُ : يا ربِّ ظَلَمَني هَذا، فَيُؤخَذُ مِن حَسَناتِهِ فَيُجعَلُ في حَسَناتِ الذي سَألَهُ، فما يَزالُ كذلكَ حتّى‏ ما يَبقى‏ لَهُ حَسَنةٌ، فإذا جاءَ مَن يَسألُهُ نَظَرَ إلى‏ سَيِّئاتِهِ فَجُعِلَت مَع سيّئاتِ الرَّجُلِ، فلا يَزالُ يُستَوفى‏ مِنهُ حتّى‏ يَدخُلَ النارَ
hadiths.english: 3869. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Verily the servant will come on the Day of Resurrection having performed many good deeds which please him, when a man will come, complaining [to Allah], ‘O Lord, this man has wronged me’, whereupon some of his good deeds will be taken and transferred to the good deeds of the plaintiff. The situation will continue thus until finally he will be left with no good deeds, and then the plaintiff’s evil deeds will start being transferred to his own evil deeds, and he will continue to pay for them thus until he will enter the Fire.’

hadiths.arabic: 3870. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : اتَّقُوا الظُّلمَ؛ فإنّهُ ظُلُماتٌ يَومَ القِيامَةِ
hadiths.english: 3870. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Fear wrongdoing, for verily it is a source of darkness on the Day of Resurrection.’

hadiths.arabic: 3871. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الظُّلمُ ألأمُ الرَّذائلِ
hadiths.english: 3871. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Wrongdoing is the most painful of all vices.’

hadiths.arabic: 3872. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الظُّلمُ يُزِلُّ القَدَمَ، ويَسلُبُ النِّعَمَ ويُهلِكُ الاُمَمَ
hadiths.english: 3872. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Wrongdoing causes feet to slip, snatches away bounties and destroys nations.’

hadiths.arabic: 3873. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - في خُطبَةٍ لَهُ يَتَبَرَّأُ مِن الظُّلمِ - : واللَّهِ لأََن أبِيتَ عَلى‏ حَسَكِ السَّعدانِ مُسَهَّداً، أو اُجَرَّ في الأغلالِ مُصَفَّداً، أحَبُّ إلَيَّ مِن أن ألقَى اللَّهَ ورسولَهُ يَومَ القِيامَةِ ظالِماً لِبَعضِ العِبادِ، وغاصِباً لِشَي‏ءٍ مِن الحُطامِ، وكيفَ أظلِمُ أحَداً لِنَفسٍ يُسرِعُ إلى البِلى‏ قُفُولُها، ويَطُولُ في الثَّرى‏ حُلُولُها ؟!
hadiths.english: 3873. Imam Ali (AS) said, denouncing wrongdoing, ‘By Allah, I would rather spend a sleepless night on the thorns of the Sadan tree [a type of prickly tree], or be driven as a prisoner in shackles, than meet Allah and His Messenger on the Day of Resurrection having wronged any servant or having usurped any kind of worldly wealth. How can I wrong anyone for the sake of this soul that is rapidly hastening towards destruction and is to remain under the earth for a long time?’

hadiths.arabic: 3874. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - أيضاً - : واللَّهِ لو اُعطِيتُ الأقاليمَ السَّبعَةَ بما تَحتَ أفلاكِها، على‏ أن أعصِيَ اللَّهَ في‏نَملَةٍ أسلُبُها جُلْبَ‏شَعِيرَةٍ ما فَعَلتُهُ.
hadiths.english: 3874. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘By Allah, if I was given all the seven domains with all that exists under its celestial spheres in order that I may disobey Allah to the extent of snatching a single grain of barley from an ant, I would not do it.’

hadiths.arabic: 3875. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إيّاكَ والظُّلمَ؛ فَمَن ظَلَمَ كَرُهَت أيّامُهُ
hadiths.english: 3875. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Beware of wrongdoing, for the living days of one who wrongs others become odious.’

hadiths.arabic: 3876. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لَيسَ شَي‏ءٌ أدعى‏ إلى‏ تَغييرِ نِعمَةِ اللَّهِ وتَعجِيلِ نِقْمَتِهِ مِن إقامَةٍ على‏ ظُلمٍ؛ فإنّ اللَّهَ سَميعُ دَعوَةِ المُضطَهَدِينَ (المَظلومِينَ)، وهُو للظالِمينَ بِالمِرصادِ
hadiths.english: 3876. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Nothing induces the reversal of Allah’s bounty or the hastening of His retribution than continuous injustice [to others]; for verily Allah hears the call of the oppressed and lies in wait for the oppressors.’

hadiths.arabic: 3877. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن ظَلَمَ قُصِمَ عُمرُهُ
hadiths.english: 3877. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The life of one who wrongs others is shattered.’

hadiths.arabic: 3878. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : راكِبُ الظُّلمِ يَكبُو بِهِ مَركَبُهُ
hadiths.english: 3878. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The one who takes wrongdoing as a mount is thrown off by it.’

hadiths.arabic: 3879. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن جارَ أهلَكَهُ جَورُهُ
hadiths.english: 3879. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The one who tyrannises others is ruined by his own tyranny.’

hadiths.arabic: 3880. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : نهى‏ رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله أن يُؤكَلَ ماتَحمِلُ النَّملَةُ بِفِيها وقَوائمِها
hadiths.english: 3880. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) narrated, ‘The Prophet (SAWA) forbade anyone from eating anything that an ant carries in its mouth or holds in its grip.’

hadiths.arabic: 3881. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ألا وإنَّ الظُّلمَ ثلاثةٌ : فَظُلمٌ لا يُغفَرُ، وظُلمٌ لا يُترَكُ، وظُلمٌ مَغفورٌ لا يُطلَبُ، فأمّا الظُّلمُ الذي لا يُغفَرُ فالشِّركُ بِاللَّهِ وأمّا الظُّلمُ الذي يُغفَرُ فَظُلمُ العَبدِ نفسَهُ عندَ بعضِ الهَناتِ، وأمّا الظُّلمُ الذي لا يُترَكُ فظُلمُ العِبادِ بَعضِهِم بَعضاً
hadiths.english: 3881. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Know that wrongdoing is of three types: the wrongdoing that is unforgivable, the wrongdoing that cannot be left unaccounted, and the wrongdoing that is forgivable and unquestioned. The wrong that is unforgivable is association of anything with Allah …the wrong that is forgivable is when the servant is unjust to himself and wrongs himself with regard to his faults, and the wrong that cannot be left unaccounted is the wrong that people do unto each other.’

sections.section_title_en: The Most Atrocious Type of Wrong

hadiths.arabic: 3882. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : اشتَدَّ غَضَبُ اللَّهِ عَلى‏ مَن ظَلَمَ مَن لا يَجِدُ ناصِراً غَيرَ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 3882. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘The wrath of Allah is indeed severe on one who wrongssomebody that has no one to help him apart from Allah.’

hadiths.arabic: 3883. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ظُلمُ الضَّعيفِ أفحَشُ الظُّلمِ
hadiths.english: 3883. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Wronging the weak is the most atrocious type of injustice.’

hadiths.arabic: 3884. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - لَمّا سُئلَ : أيُّ ذنبٍ أعجَلُ عُقوبَةً لِصاحِبِهِ ؟ - : مَن ظَلَمَ مَن لا ناصِرَ لَهُ إلّا اللَّهُ، وجاوَرَ النِّعمَةَ بِالتَّقصيرِ ، واستَطالَ بِالبَغيِ على الفَقيرِ
hadiths.english: 3884. Imam Ali (AS) was once asked, ‘Which sin hastens punishment down on its perpetrator the fastest?’ to which he replied, ‘He who wrongs somebody that has no helper save Allah, he who repays bounties with negligence and laxity, and he who displays arrogant and intimidating behaviour towards the poor.’

hadiths.arabic: 3885. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مِن أفحَشِ الظُّلمِ ظُلمُ الكِرامِ
hadiths.english: 3885. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘One of the most atrocious types of injustice is to wrong kind people.’

hadiths.arabic: 3886. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : لَمّا حَضَرَ عليَّ بنَ الحُسينِ عليهما السلام الوَفاةُ ضَمَّني إلى‏ صَدرِهِ، ثُمّ قالَ : يا بُنَيَّ ، اُوصِيكَ بما أوصانِي بهِ أبي عليه السلام حينَ حَضَرَتهُ الوَفاةُ وبما ذَكَرَ أنَّ أباهُ أوصاهُ بهِ ، قالَ : يا بُنَيَّ ، إيّاكَ وظُلمَ مَن لا يَجِدُ علَيكَ ناصِراً إلّا اللَّهَ
hadiths.english: 3886. Imam al-Baqir (AS) narrated that when his father, Imam Ali Zayn al-Abidin (AS) was approaching death, he hugged him close to his chest and said, ‘O my son, I am advising you of the same thing that my father advised me in his will when he was approaching death, and the same thing that he said his father advised him - O my son! Beware of wronging one who has no helper against you but Allah.’

hadiths.arabic: 3887. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنَّ اللَّهَ يُمهِلُ الظَّالِمَ حتّى‏ يقولَ : قد أهمَلَنِي! ثُمّ يَأخُذُهُ أخذَةً رابِيَةً، إنّ اللَّهَ حَمِدَ نفسَهُ عِندَ هَلاكِ الظّالِمِينَ ، فقالَ : (فَقُطِعَ دَابِرُ القَوْمِ الّذينَ ظَلَمُوا وَالحَمْدُ للَّهِ‏ِ رَبِّ العالَمِينَ) .
hadiths.english: 3887. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Verily Allah gives such respite to the wrongdoer, until he says [rejoicingly], ‘He [Allah] has indeed forgotten about me!’ Then Allah seizes him with a terrible seizing. Verily Allah has praised Himself with regard to the way in which He destroys wrongdoers, saying in the Qur’an:“Thus the wrongdoing ones were rooted out, and all praise belongs to Allah, the Lord of all the worlds.”

hadiths.arabic: 3888. تفسير نور الثقلين : قال الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : أملَى اللَّهُ عزّ وجلّ لِفرعَونَ ما بينَ الكَلِمَتَينِ أربَعينَ سَنَةً، ثُمّ أخَذَهُ اللَّهُ نَكالَ الآخِرَةِ والاُولى‏، وكانَ بينَ أن قالَ اللَّهُ عزّوجلّ لموسى‏ وهارونَ عليهما السلام : (قد أُجِيبَتْ دَعوَتُكُما) وبينَ أن عَرَّفَهُ اللَّهُ تعالى‏ الإجابَةَ أربَعينَ سَنَةً
hadiths.english: 3888. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘Allah gave Pharaoh a long respite of forty years, between His two addresses to him, then Allah seized him with the punishment of this life and the Hereafter. So forty years passed between the time that Allah said to Prophet Moses (AS) and Prophet Aaron (AS):“Your supplication has already been granted” and between the time He actually showed them the answer to their supplication [i.e. through Pharaoh’s annihilation].’

hadiths.arabic: 3889. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الظُّلمُ نَدامَةٌ
hadiths.english: 3889. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Wrongdoing results in regret.’

hadiths.arabic: 3890. الإمامُ عليُّ عليه السلام : يَومُ العَدلِ على الظّالِمِ أشَدُّ مِن يَومِ الجَورِ على المَظلُومِ
hadiths.english: 3890. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The day that justice is brought to the wrongdoer is much more severe than the day oppression is done unto the oppressed.’

hadiths.arabic: 3891. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : ما يَأخُذُ المَظلومُ مِن دِينِ الظَّالِمِ أكثَرُ ممّا يَأخُذُ الظَّالِمُ مِن دُنيا المَظلومِ
hadiths.english: 3891. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘The wronged one profits much more from his oppressor’s Hereafter [i.e. his account of deeds] than the oppressor profits from the world [i.e. the wealth or honour] of the one he is wronging.’

hadiths.arabic: 3892. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إذا كانَ يَومُ القِيامَةِ نادى‏ مُنادٍ : أينَ الظَّلَمَةُ وأعوانُهُم ؟ مَن لاقَ لَهُم دَواةً، أو رَبَطَ لَهُم كِيساً ، أو مَدَّ لَهُم مُدَّةَ قَلَمٍ ، فَاحشُرُوهُم مَعَهُم
hadiths.english: 3892. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘On the Day of Resurrection, a caller will call out, ‘Where are the wrongdoers and their helpers? Whoever prepared the inkwell for them, or tied their purse for them, or supplied them with a pen – gather them all together with them.’

hadiths.arabic: 3893. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : العامِلُ بِالظُّلمِ والمُعينُ لَهُ والرَّاضِي بهِ شُرَكاءُ ثَلاثَتُهُم
hadiths.english: 3893. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘The perpetrator of the wrong act, his accomplice and the one who approves of it - all three are equally to blame for the wrong.’

hadiths.arabic: 3894. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لَولا أنَّ بَنِي اُمَيَّةَ وَجَدُوا مَن يَكتُبُ لَهُم، ويَجبِي لَهُمُ الفَي‏ءَ، ويُقاتِلُ عَنهُم، ويَشهَدُ جَماعَتَهُم، لَما سَلَبُونا حَقَّنا
hadiths.english: 3894. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘If it was not for the fact that the Bani Umayya found people to scribe for them, to shade them, to fight for them, and to attend their gatherings, they would never have been able to snatch away our rights [by themselves].’

hadiths.arabic: 3895. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - في قولِهِ تعالى‏ : (ولا تَرْكَنُوا إِلى الَّذِينَ ظَلَمُوا ...) - : هُوَ الرَّجُلُ يَأتِي السُّلطانَ فَيُحِبُّ بَقاءَهُ إلى‏ أن يُدخِلَ يَدَهُ إلى‏ كِيسِهِ فَيُعطِيَهُ
hadiths.english: 3895. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) with respect to Allah’s verse in the Qur’an:“And do not incline toward the wrongdoers, lest the Fire should touch you, and you will not have any friend besides Allah, then you will not be helped” , said, ‘This refers to the man who attends to an unjust ruler, wishing his rule to continue in order that he may put his hand in his purse and give him thereof.’

hadiths.arabic: 3896. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن أخَذَ لِلمَظلومِ مِنَ الظَّالِمِ كانَ مَعِيَ في الجَنَّةِ مُصاحِباً
hadiths.english: 3896. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Whoever takes the side of the oppressed over the oppressor will be with me as my companion in Paradise.’

hadiths.arabic: 3897. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - للحَسَنَينِ عليهما السلام - : قُولا بِالحَقِّ، واعمَلا لِلأجرِ، وكُونا للظَّالِمِ خَصماً ولِلمَظلومِ عَوناً
hadiths.english: 3897. Imam Ali (AS) said to Imam Hasan and Imam Husayn (AS), ‘Speak the truth, and do good deeds to secure a good reward, and be adversaries to the oppressor and aiders of the oppressed.’

hadiths.arabic: 3898. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام - لِعليِّ بنِ يَقطينٍ - : إنّ للَّهِ‏ِ تعالى‏ أولياءَ مَع أولياءِ الظَّلَمَةِ لِيَدفَعَ بِهِم عَن أوليائهِ، وأنتَ مِنهُم يا عليُّ
hadiths.english: 3898. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said to Ali b. Yaqtin, ‘Verily Allah, most High, has friends just like the friends of the oppressors, with the aid of whom He defends His friends, and you are one of them, O Ali.’

sections.section_title_en: BEING WARY OF THE PLEA [TO ALLAH] OF ONE WHO HAS BEEN WRONGED

hadiths.arabic: 3899. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : اِتَّقُوا دَعوَةَ المَظلومِ؛ فإنّما يَسألُ اللَّهُ تعالى‏ حَقَّهُ، وإنَّ اللَّهَ تعالى‏ لَم يَمنَعْ ذا حَقٍّ حَقَّهُ
hadiths.english: 3899. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Be on your guard against the plea [to Allah] of one who has been wronged, for verily he asks Allah his right, and verily Allah never denies a right to one whom it is due.’

hadiths.arabic: 3900. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : اِتَّقُوا دَعوَةَ المَظلومِ وإن كانَ كافِراً ؛ فإنّهُ لَيسَ دُونَهُ حِجابٌ
hadiths.english: 3900. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Be on your guard against the plea of one who has been wronged, even if he be a disbeliever, for verily there is no veil preventing his plea from being answered.’

hadiths.arabic: 3901. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أنفَذُ السِّهامِ دَعوَةُ المَظلومِ
hadiths.english: 3901. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The most piercing arrow is the plea of the oppressed.’

hadiths.arabic: 3902. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ظَنُّ الرَّجُلِ على‏ قَدرِ عَقلِهِ
hadiths.english: 3902. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘A man’s conjecture is proportionate to the extent of his reason.’

hadiths.arabic: 3903. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ظنُّ العاقِلِ أصَحُّ مِن يَقينِ الجاهِلِ
hadiths.english: 3903. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘An intellectual man’s conjecture is sounder than an ignorant man’s certainty.’

hadiths.arabic: 3904. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اتَّقُوا ظُنُونَ المُؤمِنِينَ؛ فإنَّ اللَّهَ تعالى‏ جَعَلَ الحَقَّ على‏ ألسِنَتِهم
hadiths.english: 3904. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Be wary of the opinions given by believers, for verily Allah has made the truth flow from their tongues.’

sections.section_title_ar: الحَثُّ عَلى‏ حُسنِ الظَّنِّ بِفِعلِ المُؤمِنِ‏
sections.section_title_en: ENJOINMENT TO ENTERTAIN GOOD OPINION ABOUT THE DEED OF A BELIEVER

hadiths.arabic: 3905. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : اُطلُبْ لأِخِيكَ عُذراً، فَإنْ لَم تَجِدْ لَهُ عُذراً فَالتَمِسْ لَهُ عُذراً
hadiths.english: 3905. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Make an excuse for your fellow brother, and even if you do not have an excuse [for his behaviour], then seek out an excuse for him.’

hadiths.arabic: 3906. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ضَعْ أمرَ أخيكَ على‏ أحسَنِهِ حتّى‏ يَأتِيَكَ مِنهُ ما يَغلِبُكَ، ولا تَظُنَّنَّ بكَلِمَةٍ خَرَجَت مِن أخيكَ سُوءاً وأنتَ تَجِدُ لَها في الخَيرِ مَحمِلاً
hadiths.english: 3906. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘See the best in any situation involving a fellow brother, until you experience something from him which proves you wrong, and do not assume the worst about something that your brother may say if you can find the possibility for good therein.’

sections.section_title_en: THE VIRTUE OF ENTERTAINING GOOD OPINIONS

hadiths.arabic: 3907. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : حُسنُ الظَّنِّ راحَةُ القَلبِ وسَلامةُ الدِّينِ
hadiths.english: 3907. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Entertaining good opinions is a comfort to the heart and [indicates] soundness of faith.’

hadiths.arabic: 3908. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : حُسنُ الظَّنِّ يُخَفِّفُ الَهمَّ ، ويُنجي من تَقَلُّدِ الإثمِ
hadiths.english: 3908. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Entertaining good opinions reduces anxiety, and saves one from being taken over by sin.’

hadiths.arabic: 3909. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن حَسُنَ ظَنُّهُ بِالناسِ حازَ مِنهُمُ المَحَبَّةَ
hadiths.english: 3909. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The one who thinks the best of people gains their love.’

hadiths.arabic: 3910. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أفضَلُ الوَرَعِ حُسنُ الظَّنِّ
hadiths.english: 3910. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The best of piety is to think the best of people.’

sections.section_title_en: CAUTION AGAINST ENTERTAINING LOW OR SUSPICIOUS OPINIONS

hadiths.arabic: 3911. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إيّاكُم والظَّنَّ؛ فإنَّ الظَّنَّ أكذَبُ الكَذِبِ
hadiths.english: 3911. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Beware of suspicion for verily suspicion is the worst of all lies.’

hadiths.arabic: 3912. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إذا ظَنَنتُم فلا تُحَقِّقُوا، وإذا حَسَدتُم فلا تَبغُوا، وإذا تَطَيَّرتُم فَامضُوا
hadiths.english: 3912. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘If you have assumed the worst [about someone or something], then do not seek to make it true. And if you are jealous [of someone or something] then do not covet them, and if you draw an evil omen from something, ignore it and walk away.’

hadiths.arabic: 3913. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنّ البُخلَ والجُبنَ والحِرصَ غَرائزُ شَتّى‏ يَجمَعُها سُوءُ الظَّنِّ بِاللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 3913. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Verily miserliness, cowardice and greed are all evil impulses caused by entertaining a low opinion of Allah.’

hadiths.arabic: 3914. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا إيمانَ مَع سُوءِ الظَّنِّ
hadiths.english: 3914. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘There is no room for faith with suspicion.’

hadiths.arabic: 3915. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : سُوءُ الظَّنِّ يُفسِدُ الاُمورَ ويَبعَثُ على الشُّرورِ
hadiths.english: 3915. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Suspicion corrupts matters and gives rise to evils.’

hadiths.arabic: 3916. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إيّاكَ أن تُسِي‏ءَ الظَّنَّ؛ فإنّ سُوءَ الظَّنِّ يُفسِدُ العِبادَةَ
hadiths.english: 3916. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Beware of entertaining suspicious thoughts for verily suspicion corrupts worship.’

hadiths.arabic: 3917. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الشِّرِّيرُ لا يَظُنُّ بِأحَدٍ خَيراً؛ لأنّهُ لا يَراهُ إلّا بِطَبعِ نَفسِهِ
hadiths.english: 3917. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The evil person cannot think well of anybody because he can only see people as he himself is predisposed.’

sections.section_title_ar: ضَرورَةُ التَّجَنُّبِ عَمّا يُوجِبُ سُوءَ الظَّنِ‏
sections.section_title_en: THE NECESSITY OF AVOIDING THAT WHICH INCITES SUSPICIOUS THOUGHTS

hadiths.arabic: 3918. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن وَقَّفَ نفسَهُ مَوقِفَ التُّهَمَةِ فلا يَلُومَنَّ مَن أساءَ بهِ الظَّنَّ
hadiths.english: 3918. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He who stands in a suspect place cannot blame anyone for thinking suspiciously of him.’

hadiths.arabic: 3919. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن دَخَلَ مَداخِلَ السَّوءِ اتُّهِمَ، مَن عَرَّضَ نَفسَهُ للتُّهَمَةِ فلا يَلُومَنَّ مَن أساءَ بهِ الظَّنَّ
hadiths.english: 3919. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The one who enters bad places naturally stands to be accused, and the one who exposes himself to accusation cannot blame anyone for thinking suspiciously of him.’

hadiths.arabic: 3920. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مُجالَسَةُ الأشرارِ تُورِثُ سُوءَ الظَّنِّ بِالأخيارِ
hadiths.english: 3920. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Sitting in the company of bad people engenders suspicious thoughts about good people.’

hadiths.arabic: 3921. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أسوَأُ النَّاسِ حالاً مَن لَم يَثِقْ بَأحَدٍ لِسُوءِ ظَنِّهِ، ولَم يَثِقْ بهِ أحَدٌ لِسُوءِ فِعلِهِ
hadiths.english: 3921. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The person in the worst state is the one who does not trust anybody because of his suspiciousness, and who is not trusted by anybody because of his evil actions.’

hadiths.arabic: 3922. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن لَم يَحسُنْ ظَنُّهُ استَوحَشَ مِن كُلِّ أحَدٍ
hadiths.english: 3922. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The one who does not think well of people will remain alienated from everybody.’

hadiths.arabic: 3923. رسولُ‏اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله: اِحتَرِسُوا مِنَ النَّاسِ بسُوءِ الظَّنِّ
hadiths.english: 3923. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Guard yourselves against people with suspicion.’

hadiths.arabic: 3924. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إذا استَولَى الصَّلاحُ على الزَّمانِ وأهلِهِ ثُمّ أساءَ رَجُلٌ الظَّنَّ برَجُلٍ لَم تَظهَرْ مِنهُ حَوبَةٌ فقد ظَلَمَ، وإذا استَولى‏ الفَسادُ على الزَّمانِ وأهلِهِ فَأحسَنَ رَجُلٌ الظَّنَّ برجُلٍ فَقَد غَرَّرَ
hadiths.english: 3924. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘At a time when good prevails over an era and among its people, if a man suspects another person who has never been seen committing an offence, then he has indeed wronged him. And when corruption prevails over an era and among its people, if a man assumes the best about somebody, then he has indeed deceived himself.’

hadiths.arabic: 3925. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : إذا كانَ الجَورُ أغلَبَ مِنَ الحَقِّ لَم يَحِلَّ لأحَدٍ أن يَظُنَّ بأحَدٍ خَيراً حتّى يَعرِفَ ذلكَ مِنهُ
hadiths.english: 3925. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, ‘At a time when injustice is more prevalent than good, it is not permitted for anyone to entertain good opinions about another unless he knows him to be such.’

hadiths.arabic: 3926. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أفضَلُ النّاسِ مَن عَشِقَ العِبادَةَ فَعانَقَها، وأحَبَّها بقَلبِهِ، وباشَرَها بِجَسَدِهِ، وتَفرَّغَ لَها، فَهُو لا يُبالي عَلى‏ ما أصبَحَ مِنَ الدُّنيا : عَلى‏ عُسرٍ أم عَلى‏ يُسرٍ
hadiths.english: 3926. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘The best of people is he who longs for worship and embraces it, loves it with his heart, throws himself into it with his whole body, and devotes himself exclusively to it, such that he is not concerned in what worldly state he wakes up in the morning: in difficulty or in ease.’

hadiths.arabic: 3927. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : كَفى‏ بِالعِبادَةِ شُغلاً
hadiths.english: 3927. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Worship suffices as an occupation.’

hadiths.arabic: 3928. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : يَقولُ رَبُّكُم : يَابنَ آدَمَ، تَفَرَّغْ لِعِبادَتي أملَأْ قَلبَكَ غِنىً وأملَأْ يَدَيكَ رِزقاً. يَابنَ آدمَ، لا تَباعَدْ مِنّي فأملَأَ قَلبَكَ فَقراً وأملَأَ يَدَيكَ شُغلاً
hadiths.english: 3928. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Your Lord addresses you, saying, ‘O son of Adam! Devote yourself exclusively to My worship and I will fill your heart with wealth and your hands with ready sustenance. O son of Adam! Do not distance yourself from Me or I will fill your heart with poverty and your hands with work [to preoccupy you].’

hadiths.arabic: 3929. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إذا أحَبَّ اللَّهُ عَبداً ألهَمَهُ حُسنَ العِبادَةِ
hadiths.english: 3929. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘When Allah loves a servant He inspires him to carry out the best forms of worship.’

hadiths.arabic: 3930. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : العُبوديَّةُ خَمسَةُ أشياءَ : خَلاءُ البَطنِ، وَقِراءةُ القرآنِ، وقِيامُ اللَّيلِ، والتَّضَرُّعُ عِندَ الصُّبحِ، والبُكاءُ مِن خَشيَةِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 3930. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Adoration [of Allah] consists of five things: keeping the stomach empty, reading the Qur’an, performing the night prayer, imploring Allah at dawn, and crying much from fear of Allah.’

sections.section_title_en: THE ROLE OF UNDERSTANDING AND CONVICTION IN WORSHIP

hadiths.arabic: 3931. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا عِبادَةَ إلّا بِيَقينٍ
hadiths.english: 3931. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘There is no use to worship without conviction.’

hadiths.arabic: 3932. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : اُعبُدِ اللَّهَ كَأ نَّكَ تَراهُ، فَإن لَم تَكُن تَراهُ، فَإنَّهُ يَراكَ
hadiths.english: 3932. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Worship Allah as if you see Him, for although you may not see Him, indeed He sees you.’

hadiths.arabic: 3933. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا خَيرَ في عِبادَةٍ ليسَ فيها تَفَقُّهٌ
hadiths.english: 3933. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Worship without understanding is no good.’

hadiths.arabic: 3934. الإمامُ زينَ العابدينُ عليه السلام : لا عِبادَةَ إلّا بالتَفَقُّهِ
hadiths.english: 3934. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, ‘There is no point to worship unless performed with understanding.’

hadiths.arabic: 3935. عيسى عليه السلام - لِرجُلٍ - : ما تَصنَعُ ؟ قالَ : أتَعَبَّدُ، قالَ : فمَن يَعودُ علَيكَ ؟ قالَ : أخي، قالَ: أخوكَ أعبَدُ مِنكَ
hadiths.english: 3935. Prophet Jesus (AS) asked a man, ‘What are you doing?’ The man replied, ‘I am worshipping.’ So he asked, ‘Then who is it that supports you [financially]?’ He replied, ‘My brother’, to which Prophet Jesus (AS) said, ‘Your brother is a better worshipper than you.’

hadiths.arabic: 3936. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : العِبادَةُ عَشرَةُ أجزاءٍ، تِسعَةُ أجزاءٍ في طَلَبِ الحَلالِ
hadiths.english: 3936. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Worship consists of ten parts, nine of which are to do with earning a lawful living.’

hadiths.arabic: 3937. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : نَظَرُ الوَلَدِ إلى‏ والِدَيهِ حُبّاً لَهُما عِبادَةٌ
hadiths.english: 3937. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘A son’s looking at his parents with love is a form of worship [of Allah].’

hadiths.arabic: 3938. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : النَّظَرُ إلَى العالِمِ عِبادَةٌ، والنَّظَرُ إلَى الإمامِ المُقسِطِ عِبادَةٌ، وَالنَّظَرُ إلَى الوالِدَينِ بِرَأفَةٍ وَرحمَةٍ عِبادَةٌ، وَالنَّظَرُ إلى‏ أخٍ تَوَدُّهُ في اللَّهِ عَزَّوجلَّ عِبادَةٌ
hadiths.english: 3938. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Looking at [the face of] a scholar is worship, looking at [the face of] a just leader (Imam) is worship, looking at one’s parents with kindness and mercy is worship, and looking at the face of a brother whom you love for the sake of Allah is worship.’

hadiths.arabic: 3939. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : حُسنُ الظَّنِّ باللَّهِ مِن عِبادَةِ اللَّهِ تعالى‏
hadiths.english: 3939. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Entertaining the best opinion about Allah is a form of worship of Allah, most High.’

hadiths.arabic: 3940. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : التَّفَكُّرُ في مَلَكوتِ السّماواتِ والأرضِ عِبادَةُ المُخلِصينَ
hadiths.english: 3940. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Pondering about the dominion of the heavens and the earth is the worship of the sincere ones.’

hadiths.arabic: 3941. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إنّ مِنَ العِبادَةِ لِينَ الكَلامِ وإفشاءَ السَّلامِ
hadiths.english: 3941. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Verily part of worship is to talk to people in a gentle manner and to spread the greeting of peace among them.’

hadiths.arabic: 3942. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنّ فَوقَ كلِّ عِبادَةٍ عِبادَةً، و حُبُّنا أهلَ البَيتِ أفضَلُ عِبادَةٍ
hadiths.english: 3942. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Verily above every act of worship is an even better act of worship, and love for us, the household of the Prophet, is the best act of worship.’

hadiths.arabic: 3943. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : (إنّ) العُبّادَ ثَلاثةٌ : قَومٌ عَبَدوا اللَّهَ عَزَّوجلَّ خَوفاً فتِلكَ عِبادَةُ العَبيدِ، وَقَوم عَبَدوا اللَّهَ تَباركَ وتَعالى‏ طَلَبَ الثَّوابِ فتِلكَ عِبادَةُ الاُجَراءِ، وقَوم عَبَدوا اللَّهَ عَزَّوجلَّ حُبّاً لَهُ فَتِلكَ عِبادَةُ الأحرارِ، وهِيَ أفضَلُ العِبادَةِ
hadiths.english: 3943. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Worshippers are of three types: people who worship Allah, Mighty and Exalted, out of fear, and that is the worship of a slave; people who worship Allah, Blessed and most High, seeking to be rewarded thereof, and that is the worship of an employyee; and people who worship Allah, Mighty and Exalted, out of love for Him, and that is the worship of free men and is the best type of worship.’

hadiths.arabic: 3944. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن أطاعَ رَجُلاً في مَعصِيَةٍ فقَد عَبَدَهُ
hadiths.english: 3944. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘He who obeys someone in committing an act of disobedience [to Allah] has indeed worshipped him.’

hadiths.arabic: 3945. الإمامُ الجوادُ عليه السلام : مَن أصغى‏ إلى‏ ناطِقٍ فقَد عَبَدَهُ، فإن كانَ النّاطِقُ يُؤَدّي عَنِ اللَّهِ عَزَّوجلَّ فقَد عَبَدَ اللَّهَ، وإن كانَ النّاطِقُ يُؤَدّي عنِ الشَّيطانِ فقَد عَبَدَ الشَّيطانَ
hadiths.english: 3945. Imam al-Jawad (AS) said, ‘Whoever gives a speaker his full attention has indeed expressed a form of worship or adulation to him. If the speaker leads one to Allah through his words, then it is as if one worships Allah [by giving him attention], but if he leads one to Satan through his words, it is as if one worships Satan.’

hadiths.arabic: 3946. ارشاد القلوب : في حديثِ المِعراجِ : يا أحمدُ، ليسَ شَي‏ءٌ مِنَ العِبادَةِ أحَبَّ إلَيَّ مِنَ الصَّمتِ والصَّومِ
hadiths.english: 3946. Irshad al-Qulub: ‘In the tradition of the Prophet’s Ascension, Allah said: ‘O Ahmad, no worship is dearer to me than silence and fasting.’

hadiths.arabic: 3947. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أفضَلُ العِبادَةِ الفِقهُ
hadiths.english: 3947. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘The best form of worship is to gain an understanding [of religion].’

hadiths.arabic: 3948. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أعظَمُ العِبادَةِ أجراً أخفاها
hadiths.english: 3948. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘The worship deserving of the greatest reward is that which is most discreetly performed.’

hadiths.arabic: 3949. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أفضَلُ العِبادَةِ العَفافُ
hadiths.english: 3949. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The best form of worship is self-restraint.’

hadiths.arabic: 3950. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أفضَلُ العِبادَةِ غَلَبَةُ العادَةِ
hadiths.english: 3950. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The best form of worship is breaking a habit or an addiction.’

hadiths.arabic: 3951. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أفضَلُ العِبادَةِ الزَّهادَةُ
hadiths.english: 3951. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The best form of worship is abstinence.’

hadiths.arabic: 3952. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : أفضَلُ العِبادَةِ العِلمُ بِاللَّهِ والتَّواضُعُ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 3952. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘The best form of worship is coming to know Allah and humbling oneself before Him.’

hadiths.arabic: 3953. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : أفضَلُ العِبادَةِ إدمانُ التَّفَكُّرِ في اللَّهِ وفي قُدرَتِهِ
hadiths.english: 3953. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘The best form of worship is to be in a state of perpetual reflection about Allah and His power.’

hadiths.arabic: 3954. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : واللَّهِ ما عُبِدَ اللَّهُ بِشي‏ءٍ أفضَلَ مِن أداءِ حَقِّ المُؤمِنِ
hadiths.english: 3954. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘By Allah, there is no better way to worship Allah than to fulfil the right of a fellow believer.’

hadiths.arabic: 3955. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : أعبَدُ النّاسِ مَن أقامَ الفَرائضَ
hadiths.english: 3955. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘The best worshipper among people is he who performs the acts obligatory upon him.’

hadiths.arabic: 3956. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : لَيسَتِ العِبادَةُ كَثرَةَ الصِّيامِ وَالصَّلاةِ، وَإنَّما العِبادَةُ كَثرَةُ التَّفَكُّرِ في أمرِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 3956. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, ‘Worship is not about fasting or praying much, rather worship is to reflect much on the affairs related to Allah.’

hadiths.arabic: 3957. الإمامُ الجوادُ عليه السلام : أفضَلُ العِبادَةِ الإخلاصُ
hadiths.english: 3957. Imam al-Jawad (AS) said, ‘The best form of worship is sincerity.’

hadiths.arabic: 3958. عيسى عليه السلام : بِحقٍّ أقولُ لَكُم : إنَّهُ كَما يَنظُرُ المَريضُ إلى‏ طَيِّبِ الطَّعامِ فلا يَلتَذُّهُ مَعَ ما يَجِدُهُ مِن شِدَّةِ الوَجَعِ، كذلِكَ صاحِبُ الدّنيا لا يَلتَذُّ بِالعِبادَةِ ولا يَجِدُ حَلاوَتَها مَعَ ما يَجِدُ مِن حُبِّ المالِ
hadiths.english: 3958. Prophet Jesus (AS) said, ‘With truth I tell you that verily just as the sick man can only look at good food but cannot enjoy it due to the intense pain he suffers, similarly the man engrossed in worldly affairs cannot enjoy worship nor taste its sweetness because of the love that he harbours for worldly possessions.’

hadiths.arabic: 3959. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : آفَةُ العِبادَةِ الفَترَةُ
hadiths.english: 3959. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘The bane of worship is lassitude.’

hadiths.arabic: 3960. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لا تُكَرِّهوا إلى‏ أنفُسِكُمُ العِبادَةَ
hadiths.english: 3960. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Do not make worship loathsome to yourselves [by forcing it upon yourselves].’

sections.section_title_en: ENJOINMENT OF TAKING LESSON FROM MORAL ADVICE

hadiths.arabic: 3961. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : اِعتَبِروا؛ فَقَد خَلَتِ المَثُلاتُ فيمَن كانَ قَبلَكُم
hadiths.english: 3961. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Take lesson, for indeed the moral examples merely passed by your predecessors.’

hadiths.arabic: 3962. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : يَنظُرُ المُؤمِنُ إلَى الدّنيا بِعَينِ الاعتِبارِ، ويَقتاتُ مِنها بِبَطنِ الاضطِرارِ
hadiths.english: 3962. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The believer looks at the world with contemplative consideration, and he only consumes thereof within the bounds of necessity.’

hadiths.arabic: 3963. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن جَهِلَ قَلَّ اعتِبارُهُ
hadiths.english: 3963. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The ignorant one rarely takes lesson [from experiences].’

hadiths.arabic: 3964. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الاعتِبارُ مُنذِرٌ ناصِحٌ، مَن تَفَكَّرَ اعتَبَرَ، ومَنِ اعتَبَرَ اعتَزَلَ، ومَنِ اعتَزَلَ سَلِمَ
hadiths.english: 3964. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The moral lesson is a sincere warner. Whoever contemplates takes lesson, and whoever takes the lesson on board keeps away from making the same mistake twice, and whoever keeps away remains safe.’

hadiths.arabic: 3965. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الاعتِبارُ يَقودُ إلَى الرَّشادِ
hadiths.english: 3965. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Drawing a lesson [from an experience] leads one to integrity of conduct.’

hadiths.arabic: 3966. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَنِ اعتَبَرَ أبصَرَ، ومن أبصَرَ فَهِم، ومَن فَهِمَ عَلِمَ
hadiths.english: 3966. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Whoever draws a lesson [from something] gains insight into it, and whoever gains insight into it comprehends it, and whoever comprehends it comes to know it for certain.’

sections.section_title_en: THINGS THAT MUST BE CONTEMPLATED UPON AND DRAWN LESSONS FROM

hadiths.arabic: 3967. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : في تَصاريفِ الدّنيا اعتِبارٌ
hadiths.english: 3967. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘There is a lesson to be taken from the vicissitudes of this world.’

hadiths.arabic: 3968. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لَوِ اعتَبَرتَ بِما أضَعتَ مِن ماضي عُمرِكَ لَحَفِظتَ ما بَقِيَ
hadiths.english: 3968. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘If only you drew lessons from all that you have lost in what has passed of your life you would look after what is left of it.’

hadiths.arabic: 3969. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : فاعتَبِروا بِما كانَ مِن فِعلِ اللَّهِ بِإبليسَ؛ إذ أحبَطَ عَمَلَهُ الطَّويلَ، وَجَهدَهُ الجَهيدَ (الجَميلَ)
hadiths.english: 3969. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘So take lesson from how Allah dealt with Satan when he thwarted his long years of good deeds, and all his hard work [because of his outright defiance of Allah].’

hadiths.arabic: 3970. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : فاعتَبِروا بِما أصابَ الاُمَمَ المُستَكبِرينَ مِن قَبلِكُم؛ مِن بأسِ اللَّهِ وصَوْلاتِه ووَقائعِهِ ومَثُلاتِه
hadiths.english: 3970. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘So take lesson from Allah’s intense force, His attacks, His blows and His exemplary punishmentsisH that befell the arrogant nations before you.’

hadiths.arabic: 3971. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ما أكثَرَ العِبَرَ، وأقَلَّ الاعتِبارَ!
hadiths.english: 3971. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘How many the lessons, and how little the contemplation [upon them]!’

hadiths.arabic: 3973. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الاعتِبارُ يُثمِرُ العِصمَةَ.
hadiths.english: 3973. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Taking lesson [from past faults] results in immunity [from further faults and sins].’

hadiths.arabic: 3974. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : دَوامُ الاعتِبارِ يُؤَدّي إلَى الاستِبصارِ، ويُثمِرُ الازدِجارَ
hadiths.english: 3974. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Continuously taking lessons gives rise to the faculty of insight, and brings about self-restraint.’

hadiths.arabic: 3975. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن كَثُرَ اعتِبارُهُ قَلَّ عِثارُهُ
hadiths.english: 3975. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He who abundantly and frequently takes lessons [from his experiences] rarely stumbles.’

hadiths.arabic: 3976. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا وَحدَةَ أوحَشُ مِنَ العُجبِ
hadiths.english: 3976. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘There is no loneliness more frightening than self-admiration.’

hadiths.arabic: 3977. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : العُجبُ يُظهِرُ النَّقيصَةَ
hadiths.english: 3977. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Self-admiration shows up your faults.’

hadiths.arabic: 3978. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : العُجبُ حُمقٌ
hadiths.english: 3978. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Self-admiration is foolishness.’

hadiths.arabic: 3979. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : سَيِّئَةٌ تَسوؤكَ خَيرٌ عِندَ اللَّهِ مِن حَسَنَةٍ تُعجِبُكَ
hadiths.english: 3979. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘An evil deed [of yours] that upsets you is better in the sight of Allah than a good deed which you feel proud about.’

hadiths.arabic: 3980. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إيّاكَ أن تَرضى‏ عَن نَفسِكَ فَيَكثُرَ السّاخِطُ عَلَيكَ
hadiths.english: 3980. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Beware of self-satisfaction lest it increases the number of those against you.’

hadiths.arabic: 3981. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ثَمَرَةُ العُجبِ البَغضاءُ
hadiths.english: 3981. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The consequence of self-admiration is hatred [of other people towards you].’

hadiths.arabic: 3982. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الإعجابُ ضِدُّ الصَّوابِ، وآفَةُ الألبابِ
hadiths.english: 3982. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Self-admiration is the opposite of proper conduct, and is the bane of the hearts.’

hadiths.arabic: 3983. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : العُجبُ يُفسِدُ العَقلَ
hadiths.english: 3983. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Self-admiration corrupts reason.’

hadiths.arabic: 3984. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الإعجابُ يَمنَعُ الازدِيادَ
hadiths.english: 3984. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Self-admiration prevents progress.’

hadiths.arabic: 3985. الإمامُ الباقرُ أو الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليهما السلام : إنَّ اللَّهَ تَبارَكَ وتَعالى‏ يَقولُ : إنَّ مِن عِبادي مَن يَسأ لُني الشَّي‏ءَ مِن طاعَتي لِاُحِبَّهُ، فأصرِفُ ذلكَ عَنهُ لِكَي لا يُعجِبَهُ عَمَلُه
hadiths.english: 3985. Imam al-Baqir or Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Verily Allah, Blessed and most High, says, ‘Verily from among My servants is he who asks Me to enable him to perform an act of obedience to Me in order that he may procure My love, but I however, withhold that from him in order that he does not come to feel proud of that action of his.’

hadiths.arabic: 3986. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن دَخَلَهُ العُجبُ هَلَكَ
hadiths.english: 3986. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘He who is overtaken by self-admiration perishes.’

sections.section_title_ar: الحَثُّ عَلَى استِقلالِ الخَيرِ مِنَ النَّفسِ‏
sections.section_title_en: ENJOINMENT OF UNDERVALUING THE GOOD THAT ONE DOES

hadiths.arabic: 3987. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله - في صِفَةِ العاقِلِ - : يَستَكثِرُ قَليلَ الخَيرِ مِن غَيرِهِ، ويَستَقِلُّ كَثيرَ الخَيرِ مِن نَفسِهِ
hadiths.english: 3987. The Prophet (SAWA) said, describing the intelligent person, ‘He regards the little good that others do as being much and regards the abundance of good that he himself does as being little.’

hadiths.arabic: 3988. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : اِستَقلِلْ مِن نَفسِكَ كَثيرَ الطّاعَةِ للَّهِ‏ِ؛ إزراءً عَلَى النَّفسِ وتَعَرُّضاً لِلعَفوِ
hadiths.english: 3988. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘Undervalue the abundant acts of obedience that you perform for Allah, in contempt of your lower self and in order to expose yourself to Allah’s pardon.’

hadiths.arabic: 3989. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : قالَ إبليسُ - لَعنةُ اللَّهِ عَلَيهِ - لِجُنودِهِ : إذا استَمكَنتُ مِنِ ابنِ آدَمَ في ثَلاثٍ لَم اُبالِ ما عَمِلَ؛ فإنَّهُ غَيرُ مَقبولٍ مِنهُ : إذا استَكثَرَ عَمَلَهُ، ونَسِيَ ذَنبَهُ، ودَخَلَهُ العُجبُ
hadiths.english: 3989. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Iblis [Satan] – may Allah’s curse be on him – says to his troops, ‘If I can gain mastery over three things in man, I will no longer care how much good he does for it will not be accepted from him: if he overrates his good deeds, forgets his sins, and is overcome by self-admiration.’

hadiths.arabic: 3990. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ما لِابنِ آدمَ والعُجبَ ؟! وأوَّلُهُ نُطفَةٌ مَذِرَةٌ، وآخِرُهُ جيفَةٌ قَذِرَةٌ، وَهُوَ بَينَ ذلكَ يَحمِلُ العَذِرَةَ؟!
hadiths.english: 3990. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘What is the matter with man that he is so given to self-admiration when his origin was but a putrid droplet, and his end is as a filthy corpse, and between these states he is but a vessel for excrement?!’

hadiths.arabic: 3991. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : سُدَّ سَبيلَ العُجبِ بِمَعرِفةِ النَّفسِ
hadiths.english: 3991. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘Block the path of self-admiration through self-knowledge.’

hadiths.arabic: 3992. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إن كانَ المَمَرُّ عَلَى الصِّراطِ حَقّاً فالعُجبُ لِماذا ؟!
hadiths.english: 3992. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘If crossing the Sirat [Bridge extended over Hell] is a reality, then wherefore the need for self-admiration?!’

sections.section_title_ar: المُعجِزَةُ عَلامَةُ مَعرِفَةِ أنبِياءِ اللَّهِ وحُجَجِهِ‏
sections.section_title_en: MIRACLE IS A SIGN IN KNOWING THE MESSENGERS OF ALLAH AND THE IMAMS

hadiths.arabic: 3993. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : المُعجِزَةُ عَلامةٌ للَّهِ‏ِ لا يُعطيها إلّا أنبِياءَهُ ورُسُلَهُ وحُجَجَهُ؛ لِيُعرَفَ بهِ صِدقُ الصّادِقِ مِن كِذبِ الكاذِبِ
hadiths.english: 3993. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘The miracle is a sign pointing to Allah which none can produce but His prophets, His messengers and His proofs, in order that the truth of the truthful one be distinguished from the lie of the liar.’

sections.section_title_en: THE WISDOM BEHIND THE DIVERSITY OF THE PROPHETS’ MIRACLES

hadiths.arabic: 3994. الإمامُ الهاديُّ عليه السلام - في جَوابِ ابنِ السِّكِّيتِ عَن عِلّةِ بَعثِ موسى‏ بِالعَصا ويَدِهِ البَيضاءِ وآلَةِ السِّحرِ، وبَعثِ عيسى‏ بِآلَةِ الطِّبِّ، وبَعثِ مُحمَّدٍ - صلَّى اللَّهُ علَيهِ وآلِهِ وعَلى‏ جَميعِ الأنبِياءِ - بِالكَلامِ والخُطَبِ - : إنَّ اللَّهَ لَمّا بَعَثَ موسى‏ عليه السلام كانَ الغالِبُ عَلى‏ أهلِ عَصرِهِ السِّحرَ، فأتاهُم مِن عِندِ اللَّهِ بِما لَم يَكُن في وُسعِهِم مِثلُهُ، وما أبطَلَ بِهِ سِحرَهُم، وأثبَتَ بِهِ الحُجَّةَ عَلَيهِم وإنَّ اللَّهَ بَعَثَ عيسى‏ عليه السلام في وَقتٍ قَد ظَهَرَت فيهِ الزَّماناتُ واحتاجَ النّاسُ إلَى الطِّبِّ ، فأتاهُم مِن عِندِ اللَّهِ بِما لَم يَكُن عِندَهُم مِثلُهُ، وبِما أحْيا لَهُمُ المَوتى‏ ، وأبرَأ الأكمَهَ والأبرَصَ بِإذنِ اللَّهِ، وأثبَتَ بِهِ الحُجَّةَ عَلَيهِم وإنَّ اللَّهَ بَعَثَ مُحَمَّداً صلى اللَّه عليه وآله في وَقتٍ كانَ الغالِبُ على‏ أهلِ عَصرِهِ الخُطَبَ والكَلامَ - وأظُنُّهُ قالَ : الشِّعرَ - فأتاهُم مِن عِندِ اللَّهِ مِن مَواعِظِهِ وحِكَمِهِ ما أبطَلَ بِهِ قَولَهُم، وأثبَتَ بِهِ الحُجَّةَ عَلَيهِم
hadiths.english: 3994. Imam al-Hadi (AS) said in reply to Ibn Sikkit’s question about the reason for Allah’s sending Prophet Moses (AS) with the staff [that turned into a snake], his illuminated hand and magic as a resource, and His sending Prophet Jesus (AS) with medicine as a resource, and His sending Prophet Muhammad (SAWA) with speech and eloquence, ‘Verily when Allah sent Moses (AS), the trend prevalent among the people of the time was magic, so he brought them something from Allah the like of which they were incapable of producing, which thwarted their magic, and with which he demonstrated the proof against them. And verily Allah sent Jesus (AS) at a time when paralytic diseases were widespread and people needed medicine, so he brought them something from Allah the like of which they did not have, and with which he brought life to the dead, cured the blind and the leper with Allah’s permission, and demonstrated the proof against them. And verily Allah sent Muhammad (SAWA) at an era when the prevalent trend among the people of the time was speech and eloquence – and I think he even said poetry – so he brought to them Allah’s exhortations and wisdoms with which he thwarted their words, and with which he demonstrated the proof against them.’

hadiths.arabic: 3995. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنَّما أهلَكَ النّاسَ العَجَلَةُ، ولَو أنَّ النّاسَ تَثَبَّتوا لَم يَهلِكْ أحَدٌ
hadiths.english: 3995. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Verily haste has ruined people, and if instead people proceeded with caution no one would be ruined.’

hadiths.arabic: 3996. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : الأناةُ مِنَ اللَّهِ، والعَجَلَةُ مِنَ الشَّيطانِ
hadiths.english: 3996. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Deliberateness is from Allah whereas haste is from Satan.’

hadiths.arabic: 3997. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : العَجَلُ يوجِبُ العِثارَ
hadiths.english: 3997. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Haste causes stumbling.’

hadiths.arabic: 3998. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَعَ العَجَلِ يَكثُرُ الزَّلَلُ
hadiths.english: 3998. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Mistakes happen frequently [when work is done] with haste.’

hadiths.arabic: 3999. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَعَ التَّثَبُّتِ تَكونُ السَّلامَةُ، ومَعَ العَجَلَةِ تَكونُ النَّدامَةُ
hadiths.english: 3999. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Wholesome results follow cautious procedure whereas regret follows haste.’

sections.section_title_en: ENJOINMENT OF RUSHING TO DO GOOD DEEDS

hadiths.arabic: 4000. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنَّ اللَّهَ يُحِبُّ مِنَ الخَيرِ ما يُعَجَّلُ
hadiths.english: 4000. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Verily Allah loves the good that is embarked upon immediately.’

hadiths.arabic: 4001. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : التُّؤَدَةُ مَمدوحَةٌ في كُلِّ شَي‏ءٍ إلّا في فُرَصِ الخَيرِ
hadiths.english: 4001. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Deliberateness is recommended in everything except when embarking on opportunities for good-doing.’

hadiths.arabic: 4002. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : إذا هَمَمتَ بِخَيرٍ فبادِرْ؛ فإنَّكَ لا تَدري ما يَحدُثُ
hadiths.english: 4002. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘When you think of doing something good, rush to do it immediately for verily you do not know what could happen later [to prevent you from doing it].’

hadiths.arabic: 4003. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : العَدلُ أساسٌ بِه قِوامُ العالَمِ
hadiths.english: 4003. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Justice is the base that supports the whole world.’

hadiths.arabic: 4004. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : جَعَلَ اللَّهُ سُبحانَهُ العَدلَ قِواماً لِلأنامِ، وتَنزيهاً مِنَ المَظالِمِ والآثامِ، وتَسنِيَةً لِلإسلامِ
hadiths.english: 4004. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Allah, Glory be to Him, made justice a support for mankind, an eliminator of wrongs and sins, and an facilitator for Islam.’

hadiths.arabic: 4005. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : العَدلُ قِوامُ الرَّعِيَّةِ وجَمالُ الوُلاةِ
hadiths.english: 4005. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Justice is the support of the masses and the beauty [adornment] of the governors.’

hadiths.arabic: 4006. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : العَدلُ جُنَّةُ الدُّوَلِ
hadiths.english: 4006. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Justice is the shield of the nations.’

hadiths.arabic: 4007. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : بِالعَدلِ تَصلُحُ الرَّعِيَّةُ
hadiths.english: 4007. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The masses behave righteously through justice.’

hadiths.arabic: 4008. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : بِالعَدلِ تَتَضاعَفُ البَرَكاتُ
hadiths.english: 4008. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Blessings are multiplied through justice.’

hadiths.arabic: 4009. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : العَدلُ نِظامُ الإمرَةِ
hadiths.english: 4009. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Justice brings about order and endurance in authority.’

hadiths.arabic: 4010. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ما عُمِّرَتِ البُلدانُ بِمِثلِ العَدلِ
hadiths.english: 4010. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Nothing can cause nations to flourish like justice.’

hadiths.arabic: 4011. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - لَمّا سُئلَ عَن أفضَلِيّةِ العَدلِ أو الجُودِ - : العَدلُ يَضَعُ الاُمورَ مَواضِعَها، والجُودُ يُخرِجُها مِن جِهَتِها، والعَدلُ سائسٌ عامٌّ، والجُودُ عارِضٌ خاصٌّ، فالعَدلُ أشرَفُهُما وأفضَلُهُما
hadiths.english: 4011. Imam Ali (AS) was once asked which was better, justice or generosity, to which he replied, ‘Justice puts things in their rightful place, whereas generosity takes them away from their course. Justice is a general predominant state, whereas generosity is a transient characteristic. Justice is therefore the nobler and better of the two.’

hadiths.arabic: 4012. فاطمةُ الزَّهراءُ عليها السلام : فَرَضَ العَدلَ تَسكيناً لِلقُلوبِ
hadiths.english: 4012. Fatima al-Zahra’ (AS) said, ‘Allah has made justice incumbent as a source of tranquility for the hearts.’

hadiths.arabic: 4013. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : العَدلُ أحلى‏ مِنَ الماءِ يُصيبُهُ الظَّمآنُ
hadiths.english: 4013. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Justice is sweeter than water to a thirsty man.’

hadiths.arabic: 4014. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : العَدلُ أحلى‏ مِنَ الشَّهدِ، وأليَنُ مِنَ الزُّبدِ، وأطيَبُ ريحاً مِنَ المِسكِ
hadiths.english: 4014. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Justice is sweeter than honey, softer than butter and smells more fragrant than musk.’

hadiths.arabic: 4015. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن عامَلَ النّاسَ فلَم يَظلِمْهُم، وَحَدَّثَهُم فلَم يَكذِبْهُم، ووَعَدَهُم فلَم يُخلِفْهُم، فَهُو مِمَّن كَمُلَت مُروءَتُهُ، وظَهَرَت عَدالَتُهُ، ووَجَبَت اُخُوَّتُهُ، وحَرُمَت غِيبَتُهُ
hadiths.english: 4015. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘He who treats people in such a way that he never wrongs them, and speaks to them and never lies to them, and when he makes a promise to them he never breaks it, such a person is perfect in his valorous qualities, his justice is manifest, and it becomes obligatory to consider him as one’s brother and prohibited to backbite him.’

hadiths.arabic: 4016. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن صاحَبَ النّاسَ بِالَّذي يُحِبُّ أن يُصاحِبوهُ كانَ عَدلاً
hadiths.english: 4016. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘He who associates with people as he himself would like others to associate with him is indeed just.’

sections.section_title_en: ADVICE TO BE JUST AND FAIR WITH ONE’S FRIEND AND ENEMY

hadiths.arabic: 4017. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - في وَصِيَّتِهِ لِابنِهِ الحُسَينِ عليه السلام - : اُوصيكَ بِتَقوَى اللَّهِ في الغِنى‏ والفَقرِ وبِالعَدلِ عَلَى الصَّديقِ والعَدُوِّ
hadiths.english: 4017. Imam Ali (AS) said in his will to his son al-Husayn (AS), ‘I advise you to be wary of your duty to Allah in wealth and poverty … and [I advise you] of being just towards both friend and foe.’

hadiths.arabic: 4018. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أعدَلُ النّاسِ مَن أنصَفَ عَن قُوَّةٍ
hadiths.english: 4018. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The most just person is he who uses his strength even-handedly.’

hadiths.arabic: 4019. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أعدَلُ الخَلقِ أقضاهُم بالحَقِّ
hadiths.english: 4019. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The most just from all creation is he who judges best according to the truth.’

hadiths.arabic: 4020. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : غايَةُ العَدلِ أن يَعدِلَ المَرءُ في نَفسِهِ
hadiths.english: 4020. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The peak of justiceinately.’

sections.section_title_en: PROHIBITION OF SHOWING ENMITY TOWARD ANYONE

hadiths.arabic: 4021. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ما عَهِدَ إلَيَّ جَبرَئيلُ عليه السلام في شَي‏ءٍ ما عَهِدَ إلَيَّ في مُعاداةِ الرِّجالِ
hadiths.english: 4021. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Gabriel has not exhorted me against anything like he has exhorted me against showing enmity towards people.’

hadiths.arabic: 4022. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ما نُهِيتُ عن شَي‏ءٍ بَعدَ عِبادَةِ الأوثانِ ما نُهِيتُ عَن مُلاحاةِ الرِّجالِ
hadiths.english: 4022. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘After idol-worship, I have not been prohibited with anything as significantly as I have been prohibited hostility towards people.’

hadiths.arabic: 4023. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن لاحَى الرِّجالَ سَقَطَت مُروءَتُهُ وذَهَبَت كَرامَتُهُ
hadiths.english: 4023. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Whoever shows hostility towards others, his gallantry wanes and his kindness vanishes.’

hadiths.arabic: 4024. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : رَأسُ الجَهلِ مُعاداةُ النّاسِ
hadiths.english: 4024. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The peak of ignorance is showing enmity towards people.’

hadiths.arabic: 4025. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : إيّاكُم والخُصومَةَ ؛ فإنَّها تُفسِدُ القَلبَ وتُورِثُ النِّفاقَ
hadiths.english: 4025. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘Beware of antagonistic dispute for verily it corrupts the heart and engenders hypocrisy.’

hadiths.arabic: 4026. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: عِلَّةُ المُعاداةِ قِلَّةُ المُبالاةِ
hadiths.english: 4026. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The cause of enmity is lack of consideration [for others].’

hadiths.arabic: 4027. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لِكُلِّ شَي‏ءٍ بَذرٌ وبَذرُ العَداوَةِ المِزاحُ
hadiths.english: 4027. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Everything has a seed, and the seed of enmity is mockery.’

sections.section_title_en: ONE WHO MUST BE CONSIDERED AN ENEMY

hadiths.arabic: 4028. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: بَطنُ المَرءِ عَدوُّهُ
hadiths.english: 4028. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Man’s stomach is his enemy.’

hadiths.arabic: 4029. الإمامُ الجوادُ عليه السلام : قَد عاداكَ مَن سَتَرَ عَنكَ الرُّشدَ اتِّباعاً لِما تَهواهُ
hadiths.english: 4029. Imam al-Jawad (AS) said, ‘He who conceals [the path] of proper conduct from you in making you follow that which you desire is indeed your enemy.’

hadiths.arabic: 4030. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أعدى‏ عَدوِّكَ نَفسُكَ الَّتي بَينَ جَنبَيكَ
hadiths.english: 4030. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Your archenemy is your lower self that resides between your two sides.’

hadiths.arabic: 4031. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أعدى‏ عَدُوٍّ لِلمَرءِ غَضَبُهُ وشَهوَتُهُ ، فَمَن مَلَكَهُما عَلَت دَرَجَتُهُ وبَلَغَ غايَتَهُ
hadiths.english: 4031. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The worst enemy of man is his rage and lust, and he who suppresses them will make his status elevate and will reach his goal.’

sections.section_title_en: CAUTION AGAINST FEELING SECURE FROM ONE’S ENEMY

hadiths.arabic: 4032. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن نامَ عَن عَدُوِّهِ أنبَهَتهُ المَكايِدُ
hadiths.english: 4032. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Whoever falls into a sleep of neglect of his enemy is jolted awake by his crafty schemes.’

hadiths.arabic: 4033. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن نامَ لَم يُنَمْ عَنهُ
hadiths.english: 4033. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He who overlooks [his enemy] is himself surely not overlooked [by his enemy].’

hadiths.arabic: 4034. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: لا تَستَصغِرَنَّ عَدُوّاً وإن ضَعُفَ
hadiths.english: 4034. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Never underestimate an enemy even if he be weak.’

hadiths.arabic: 4035. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: مَنِ استَصلَحَ عَدُوَّهُ زَادَ في عَدَدِهِ
hadiths.english: 4035. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He who reconciles with his enemy increases the numbers [of his friends] on his own side.’

hadiths.arabic: 4036. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: مَنِ استَصلَحَ الأضدادَ بَلَغَ المُرادَ
hadiths.english: 4036. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He who reconciles with the opposition achieves his aim.’

sections.section_title_ar: ما يَنبَغي التَّسَلُّحُ بِهِ عَلَى الأعداءِ
sections.section_title_en: HOW TO ARM ONESELF AGAINST ENEMIES

hadiths.arabic: 4037. لقمانُ عليه السلام - في وَصِيَّتِهِ لاِبنِهِ - : يا بُنَيَّ ، لِيَكُن مِمّا تَتَسَلَّحُ بِهِ عَلى‏ عَدُوِّكَ فَتَصرَعُهُ المُماسَحَةُ وإعلانُ الرِّضا عَنهُ ، ولا تُزاوِلْهُ بِالمُجانَبَةِ فيَبدُوَ لَهُ ما في نَفسِكَ فَيتَأهَّبَ لَكَ
hadiths.english: 4037. Luqman (AS) said in his advice to his son, ‘O my son, make persuasion that which you arm yourself with against the enemy to knock him down and not to avoid him, and to pretend that you are pleased with him. Do not try to avoid him so that whatever you have inside be manifested to him, leading him to prepare himself for you [to reciprocate].’

sections.section_title_en: PEOPLE’S HOSTILITY TOWARDS THAT WHICH THEY ARE IGNORANT OF

hadiths.arabic: 4038. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: النّاسُ أعداءُ ما جَهِلوا
hadiths.english: 4038. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘People are hostile towards that which they are ignorant of.’

sections.section_title_en: CAUTION AGAINST DOING SOMETHING That One Would Later Have to EXCUSE ONESELF FOR

hadiths.arabic: 4039. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله: إيّاكَ وما تَعتَذِرُ مِنهُ ؛ فإنَّ فيهِ الشِّركَ الخَفِيَّ
hadiths.english: 4039. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Keep away from doing that which you must excuse yourself for, for verily that involves hidden polytheism.’

hadiths.arabic: 4040. الإمامُ الحسينُ عليه السلام : إيّاكَ وما تَعتَذِرُ مِنهُ ؛ فإنَّ المُؤمِنَ لا يُسي‏ءُ ولا يَعتَذِرُ ، والمُنافِقَ كُلَّ يَومٍ يُسي‏ءُ ويَعتَذِرُ
hadiths.english: 4040. Imam al-Husayn (AS) said, ‘Keep away from doing that which you must excuse yourself for, for verily the believer neither commits a wrong nor makes excuses for himself, whereas the hypocrite commits wrongs and makes excuses for them everyday.’

hadiths.arabic: 4041. مشكاة الأنوار عن بعضِ أصحابِهِ : قالَ أبو عَبدِ اللَّهِ عليه السلام : لا يَنبَغي لِلمُؤمِنِ أن يُذِلَّ نَفسَهُ ، قُلتُ : بِما يُذِلُّ نَفسَهُ ؟ قالَ : يَدخُلُ فيما يَعتَذِرُ مِنهُ
hadiths.english: 4041. Mishkat al-Anwar: From one of the companions of Imam al-Sadiq (AS): Imam al-Sadiq said, ‘A believer must never humiliate himself.’ When asked how he would humiliate himself, he replied, ‘By embarking upon something which he later has to make excuses for.’

sections.section_title_ar: الحَثُّ عَلى‏ قَبولِ عُذرِ مَنِ اعتَذَرَ
sections.section_title_en: ENJOINMENT OF ACCEPTING THE EXCUSE OF ONE WHO EXCUSES HIMSELF

hadiths.arabic: 4042. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن لَم يَقبَلِ المَعذِرَةَ مِن مُحِقٍّ أو مُبطِلٍ ، لَم يَرِدْ عَلَيَّ الحَوضَ
hadiths.english: 4042. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘He who does not accept an apology from someone, be it from an honest or a liar, will not be with me at the Heavenly Pool [in Paradise].’

hadiths.arabic: 4043. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اِقبَلْ عُذرَ أخيكَ ، وإن لَم يَكُن لَهُ عُذرٌ فَالتَمِسْ لَهُ عُذراً
hadiths.english: 4043. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Accept your fellow brother’s excuse, and if he has no excuse then find an excuse for him.’

hadiths.arabic: 4044. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أعقَلُ النّاسِ أعذَرُهُم لِلنّاسِ
hadiths.english: 4044. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The most understanding person is he who accepts people’s excuses most readily.’

hadiths.arabic: 4045. الإمام زين العابدين عليه السلام : إن شَتَمَكَ رَجُلٌ عَن يَمينِكَ ثُمّ تَحَوَّلَ إلى‏ يَسارِكَ واعتَذَرَ إلَيكَ فَاقبَلْ عُذرَهُ
hadiths.english: 4045. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, ‘If someone insults you on your right hand side, then moves over to your left and apologises to you, accept his apology.’

sections.section_title_en: ENJOINMENT OF KEEPING UP ONE’S REPUTATION

hadiths.arabic: 4046. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أبخَلُ النّاسِ بِعَرضِهِ ، أسخاهُم بِعِرضِهِ
hadiths.english: 4046. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The most miserly of people with his wares is the most liberal of them with his own reputation [in that he gives it up readily].’

hadiths.arabic: 4047. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: أفضَلُ الغِنى‏ ما صِينَ بِهِ العِرضُ
hadiths.english: 4047. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The best form of wealth is that which is used to safeguard one’s reputation.’

hadiths.arabic: 4048. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: مَن ضَنَّ بِعِرضِهِ فلْيَدَعِ المِراءَ
hadiths.english: 4048. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He who cares for his reputation must desist from disputation.’

hadiths.arabic: 4049. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إذا رَقَّ العِرضُ اسْتُصعِبَ جَمعُهُ
hadiths.english: 4049. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘When reputation wanes, it becomes very difficult to restore.’

sections.section_title_en: THE REWARD FOR REFRAINING FROM TARNISHING FELLOW MUSLIMS’ REPUTATIONS

hadiths.arabic: 4050. الإمامُ زينَ العابدينُ عليه السلام : مَن كَفَّ عَن أعراضِ المُسلِمينَ أقالَهُ اللَّهُ عَزَّوجلَّ عَثرَتَهُ يَومَ القِيامَةِ
hadiths.english: 4050. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, ‘He who refrains from tarnishing fellow Muslims’ reputations, Allah, Mighty and Exalted, regards his offence as undone on the Day of Resurrection.’

sections.section_title_en: THE REWARD FOR DEFENDING THE REPUTATION OF A FELLOW MUSLIM

hadiths.arabic: 4051. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن رَدَّ عَن عِرضِ أخيهِ كانَ لَهُ حِجاباً مِنَ النّارِ
hadiths.english: 4051. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘He who guards the reputation of his fellow brother is veiled from the Fire.’

hadiths.arabic: 4052. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن رَدَّ عَن عِرضِ أخيهِ المُسلِمِ وَجَبَت لَهُ الجَنَّةُ البَتَّةَ
hadiths.english: 4052. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘He who guards the reputation of his fellow Muslim brother definitely becomes deserving of obligatory entrance into Paradise.’

hadiths.arabic: 4053. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : أفضَلُكُم إيماناً أفضَلُكُم مَعرِفَةً
hadiths.english: 4053. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘The ones from among you with the best faith are the ones with the best inner knowledge.’

hadiths.arabic: 4054. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : العِلمُ أوَّلُ دَليلٍ، والمَعرِفَةُ آخِرُ نِهايَةٍ
hadiths.english: 4054. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Knowledge is the first guide whereas inner knowledge [of Allah] is the ultimate goal.’

hadiths.arabic: 4055. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : المَعرِفَةُ نورُ القَلبِ
hadiths.english: 4055. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Inner knowledge is the light of the heart.’

hadiths.arabic: 4056. الإمامُ الحسينُ عليه السلام : دِراسَةُ العِلمِ لِقاحُ المَعرِفةِ
hadiths.english: 4056. Imam al-Husayn (AS) said, ‘The acquisition of knowledge is the seed for [the growth of] inner knowledge.’

hadiths.arabic: 4057. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لا يَقبَلُ اللَّهُ عَمَلاً إلّا بِمَعرِفَةٍ ، ولا مَعرِفَةً إلّا بِعَمَلٍ ، فمَن عَرَفَ دَلَّتهُ المَعرِفَةُ عَلَى العَمَلِ ، ومَن لَم يَعمَلْ فلا مَعرِفَةَ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 4057. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Allah does not accept any act without inner knowledge and inner knowledge only comes through prior action. So, whoever gains knowledge intrinsically, his knowledge will lead him to action, and whoever does not act does not have any inner knowledge.’

hadiths.arabic: 4058. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : نورُ الحِكمَةِ الجُوعُ ، والتَّباعُدُ مِنَ اللَّهِ الشِّبَعُ ، والقُربَةُ إلَى اللَّهِ حُبُّ المَساكينِ والدُّنُوُّ مِنهُم ، لا تَشبَعوا فَيُطفَأَ نورُ المَعرِفةِ مِن قُلوبِكُم
hadiths.english: 4058. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘The light of inner knowledge is brought about by hunger whereas distance from Allah is caused by satiety. Proximity to Allah is brought about by loving the poor and drawing near to them, so do not eat to your fill lest the light of inner knowledge be extinguished from your hearts.’

sections.section_title_en: THE INNER KNOWLEDGE OF THE SELF

hadiths.arabic: 4059. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَعرِفَةُ النَّفسِ أنفَعُ المَعارِفِ
hadiths.english: 4059. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The inner knowledge of the self is the most beneficial of all such knowledge.’

hadiths.arabic: 4060. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : نالَ الفَوزَ الأكبَرَ مَن ظَفِرَ بِمَعرِفَةِ النَّفسِ
hadiths.english: 4060. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The one who attains knowledge of his own self has obtained the greatest victory indeed.’

hadiths.arabic: 4061. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : كَيفَ يَعرِفُ غَيرَهُ مَن يَجهَلُ نَفسَهُ ؟ !
hadiths.english: 4061. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘How can one who is ignorant of his own self expect to know others?!’

hadiths.arabic: 4062. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن عَرَفَ نَفسَهُ جاهَدَها ، مَن جَهِلَ نَفسَهُ أهمَلَها
hadiths.english: 4062. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He who gains inner knowledge of his self combats it, and he who remains ignorant of his self, neglects it.’
