hadiths.arabic: 4063. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن عَرَفَ اللَّهَ تَوَحَّدَ ، مَن عَرَفَ نَفسَهُ تَجَرَّدَ ، مَن عَرَفَ الدّنيا تَزَهَّدَ ، مَن عَرَفَ النّاسَ تَفَرَّدَ
hadiths.english: 4063. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He who attains inner knowledge of Allah believes in His Unity; he who attains inner knowledge of his self strips himself [of all that hinders its progress]; he who attains inner knowledge about this world abstains from it; and he who attains inner knowledge about people prefers solitude.’

hadiths.arabic: 4064. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أكثَرُ النّاسِ مَعرِفَةً لِنَفسِهِ أخوَفُهُم لِرَبِّهِ
hadiths.english: 4064. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The person who knows his self the best is he who fears his Lord the most.’

hadiths.arabic: 4065. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن عَرَفَ نَفسَهُ عَرَفَ رَبَّهُ
hadiths.english: 4065. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He who attains inner knowledge of his self attains inner knowledge of his Lord.’

hadiths.arabic: 4066. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : يَنبَغي لِمَن عَلِمَ شَرَفَ نَفسِهِ أن يُنَزِّهَها عَن دَناءَةِ الدّنيا
hadiths.english: 4066. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘It befits one who knows the dignity of his own self to deem it too great for the vileness of this world.’

hadiths.arabic: 4067. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : يَنبَغي لِمَن عَرَفَ نَفسَهُ أن يَلزَمَ القَناعَةَ والعِفَّةَ
hadiths.english: 4067. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘It befits one who knows the dignity of his own self to adhere to temperance and self-restraint.’

hadiths.arabic: 4068. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : يَنبَغي لِمَن عَرَفَ نَفسَهُ أن لا يُفارِقَهُ الحُزنُ والحَذَرُ
hadiths.english: 4068. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘It befits one who knows the dignity of his own self to never allow a sorrowful and self-cautious state to leave him.’

hadiths.arabic: 4069. الإمامُ زينَ العابدينُ عليه السلام - في الدُّعاءِ - : واجعَلنا مِنَ الّذين عَرَفوا أنفُسَهُم ، وأيقَنوا بِمُستَقَرِّهِم ، فكانَت أعمارُهُم في طاعَتِكَ تَفنى‏
hadiths.english: 4069. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said in one of his supplications, ‘Make us from among those who have attained inner knowledge of their selves and are convinced of their true abode, such that they spend their whole lives in Your obedience.’

hadiths.arabic: 4070. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام - في وَصِيَّتِهِ لِجابِرٍ الجُعفيِّ - : لا مَعرِفةَ كَمَعرِفَتِكَ بِنَفسِكَ
hadiths.english: 4070. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said in his advice to Jabir al-Jufi, ‘There is no inner knowledge like your inner knowledge of your own self.’

sections.section_title_en: THE FRUITS OF INNER KNOWLEDGE OF ALLAH

hadiths.arabic: 4077. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن عَرَفَ اللَّهَ وعَظَّمَهُ مَنَعَ فاهُ مِنَ الكَلامِ وبَطنَهُ مِنَ الطَّعامِ ، وعَنّى‏ نَفسَهُ بِالصِّيامِ والقِيامِ
hadiths.english: 4077. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘He who attains inner knowledge of Allah and aggrandizes Him forbids his mouth from speaking [vain] and his stomach from eating, and debilitates himself through fasting and praying.’

hadiths.arabic: 4078. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لَو عَرَفتُمُ اللَّهَ حَقَّ مَعرِفتِهِ لَمَشَيتُم عَلَى البُحورِ ، ولَزالَت بِدُعائكُمُ الجِبالُ
hadiths.english: 4078. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘If you truly knew Allah as He is worthy of being known, you would be able to walk on the seas and the mountains would fall by your command.’

hadiths.arabic: 4079. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن كانَ بِاللَّهِ أعرَفَ كانَ مِنَ اللَّهِ أخوَفَ
hadiths.english: 4079. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘He who is most knowledgeable of Allah is most fearful of Allah.’

hadiths.arabic: 4080. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : يَسيرُ المَعرِفَةِ يُوجِبُ الزُّهدَ في الدّنيا
hadiths.english: 4080. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The least knowledge of Allah leads one to abstain from the vanities of this world.’

hadiths.arabic: 4081. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إِنَّهُ لا يَنبَغي لِمَن عَرَفَ عَظَمَةَ اللَّهِ أن يَتَعَظَّمَ ؛ فإنَّ رِفعَةَ الّذينَ يَعلَمونَ ما عَظَمَتُهُ أن يَتَواضَعوا لَهُ
hadiths.english: 4081. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Verily it does not befit one who has attained inner knowledge of the grandeur of Allah to behave proudly, for verily the elevation of those who acknowledge His grandeur comes from their abasing themselves in front of Him.’

hadiths.arabic: 4082. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : غايَةُ المَعرِفَةِ الخَشيَةُ
hadiths.english: 4082. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The peak of inner knowledge of Allah is fear [of Him].’

hadiths.arabic: 4083. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أعلَمُ النّاسِ بِاللَّهِ أكثَرُهُم لَهُ مَسألَةً
hadiths.english: 4083. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The person who best knows Allah asks of Him the most.’

hadiths.arabic: 4084. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : أحَقُّ خَلقِ اللَّهِ أن يُسَلِّمَ لِما قَضَى اللَّهُ عَزَّوجلَّ : مَن عَرَفَ اللَّهَ عَزَّوجلَّ
hadiths.english: 4084. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘The creature of Allah most eligible for submission to the decree of Allah, Mighty and Exalted, is he who knows Allah, Mighty and Exalted.’

hadiths.arabic: 4085. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن عَرَفَ اللَّهَ خافَ اللَّهَ ، ومَن خافَ اللَّهَ سَخَت نَفسُهُ عَنِ الدّنيا
hadiths.english: 4085. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘He who attains inner knowledge of Allah fears Allah, and he who fears Allah restrains himself from this world.’

hadiths.arabic: 4086. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنَّ أعلَمَ النّاسِ بِاللَّهِ أرضاهُم بِقَضاءِ اللَّهِ عَزَّوجلَّ
hadiths.english: 4086. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Verily the person who best knows Allah is the most content with the decree of Allah, Mighty and Exalted.’

sections.section_title_en: THE DESCRIPTION OF THE ONE WHO KNOWS ALLAH [OR THE GNOSTIC]

hadiths.arabic: 4087. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : العارِفُ وَجهُهُ مُستَبشِرٌ مُتَبَسِّمٌ ، وقَلبُهُ وَجِلٌ مَحزونٌ
hadiths.english: 4087. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The gnostic’s face is cheerful and smily, whereas his heart is apprehensive and sorrowful.’

hadiths.arabic: 4088. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الشَّوقُ خُلصانُ العارِفينَ
hadiths.english: 4088. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Longing [for Allah] is the sincerest friend of the gnostics.’

hadiths.arabic: 4089. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الخَوفُ جِلبابُ العارِفينَ
hadiths.english: 4089. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Fear is the cloak of the gnostics.’

hadiths.arabic: 4090. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : البُكاءُ مِن خِيفَةِ اللَّهِ لِلبُعدِ عَنِ اللَّهِ عِبادَةُ العارِفينَ
hadiths.english: 4090. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Crying much due to fear of Allah for any possible distance between oneself and Allah is the regular worshippful state of the gnostics.’

hadiths.arabic: 4091. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : ثِقْ بِاللَّهِ تَكُن عارِفاً
hadiths.english: 4091. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Trust in Allah and you will attain inner knowledge [of Him].’

sections.section_title_en: THE LOWEST DEGREE OF INNER KNOWLEDGE OF ALLAH

hadiths.arabic: 4092. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام - لَمّا سُئلَ عَن أدنَى المَعرِفةِ - : الإقرارُ بأ نَّهُ لا إلهَ غَيرُهُ ، ولا شِبهَ لَهُ ولا نَظيرَ وأ نَّهُ قَديمٌ ، مُثبَتٌ ، مَوجودٌ ، غَيرُ فَقيدٍ ، وأ نَّهُ لَيسَ كَمِثلِه شَي‏ءٌ
hadiths.english: 4092. Imam al-Kazim (AS), when he was asked about the lowest degree of inner knowledge, replied, ‘It is to affirm that there is no god but He, and that He has no likeness or match, and that He is eternal, perpetual and everlasting. He is All-existent and not absent, and that there is nothing like Him.’

sections.section_title_en: ATTAINING INNER KNOWLEDGE OF ALLAH THROUGH ALLAH HIMSELF

hadiths.arabic: 4093. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اِعرِفوا اللَّهَ بِاللَّهِ ، والرَّسولَ بِالرِّسالَةِ ، واُولي الأمرِ بِالأمرِ بِالمَعروفِ والعَدلِ والإحسانِ
hadiths.english: 4093. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Get to know Allah through Allah, and the Prophet through the message he brought, and those vested with authority through their command to do good, their justice and righteousness.’

hadiths.arabic: 4094. الإمامُ الحسينُ عليه السلام - في الدُّعاءِ - : إلهي تَرَدُّدي في الآثارِ يُوجِبُ بُعدَ المَزارِ ، فاجمَعْني عَلَيكَ بِخِدمَةٍ تُوصِلُني إلَيكَ ، كَيفَ يُستَدَلُّ عَلَيكَ بِما هُوَ في وُجودِهِ مُفتَقِرٌ إلَيكَ ؟ ! أيَكونُ لِغَيرِكَ مِنَ الظُّهورِ ما لَيسَ لَكَ حتّى‏ يَكونَ هُوَالمُظهِرَ لَكَ ؟! متى‏ غِبتَ حتّى‏ تَحتاجَ إلى‏ دَليلٍ يَدُلُّ عَلَيكَ ؟ ! بِكَ أستَدِلُّ عَلَيكَ فَاهْدِني بِنورِكَ إلَيكَ
hadiths.english: 4094. Imam al-Husayn (AS) said in one of his supplications, ‘My God! My own concentration on the signs [in nature] prevents me from seeing You, so draw me near to You through Your service that may allow me to reach You. How can something that needs You for its very existence be used to prove Your existence?! Are other things more manifest than You that they be used to point to You?! When were You ever absent that You should need anything to prove Your existence?! Through You alone do I arrive at You, so guide me with Your light to Yourself.’

hadiths.arabic: 4095. الإقبال عن الإمامِ زينِ العابدينَ عليه السلام - في الدّعاءِ - : بِكَ عَرَفتُكَ و أنتَ دَلَلتَني عَلَيكَ و دَعَوتَني إلَيكَ ، و لَولا أنتَ لَم أدرِ ما أنتَ
hadiths.english: 4095. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said in one of his supplications, ‘I have attained knowledge of You through You, and You are the One Who indicated me to Yourself and called me to Yourself, and were it not for You, I would not know who You are.’

sections.section_title_ar: النَّهيُ عَنِ التَّفَكُّرِ في ذاتِ اللَّهِ‏
sections.section_title_en: PROHIBITION OF PONDERING ABOUT ALLAH’S ESSENCE

hadiths.arabic: 4096. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : تَفَكَّروا في خَلقِ اللَّهِ ، ولا تَفَكَّروا في اللَّهِ فتَهلِكوا
hadiths.english: 4096. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Ponder about the creation of Allah, but do not ponder about Allah Himself [His essence] lest you be ruined.’

hadiths.arabic: 4097. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إيّاكُم والتَّفَكُّرَ في اللَّهِ؛ فإنَّ التَّفَكُّرَ في اللَّهِ لا يَزيدُ إلّا تِيهاً ، إنَّ اللَّهَ عَزَّوجلَّ لا تُدرِكُهُ الأبصارُ ولا يُوصَفُ بِمِقدارٍ
hadiths.english: 4097. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Beware of pondering about [the essence of] Allah, for verily pondering about Allah only increases one’s bewilderment. Verily Allah, Mighty and Exalted, cannot be perceived by the sights or described by any type of criteria and measurement.’

hadiths.arabic: 4098. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن نَظَرَ في اللَّهِ كَيفَ هُوَ هَلَكَ
hadiths.english: 4098. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Ruined is the one who ponders into [the essence of] Allah!’

sections.section_title_en: THE INTELLECTS’ INCAPACITY TO FATHOM HIS ESSENCE

hadiths.arabic: 4099. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : فلَسنا نَعلَمُ كُنهَ عَظَمَتِكَ، إلّا أنّا نَعلَمُ أنَّكَ حَيٌّ قَيّومٌ ، لا تَأخُذُكَ سِنَةٌ ولا نَومٌ ، لَم يَنتَهِ إلَيكَ نَظَرٌ ، ولَم يُدرِكْكَ بَصَرٌ
hadiths.english: 4099. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘We do not know the essence of Your greatness. All that we do know is that You are Ever-Living and Self-Subsisting through Whom all things subsist. Drowsiness and sleep do not overtake You, vision does not reach You and sight cannot perceive You.’

hadiths.arabic: 4100. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - في صِفَةِ المَلائكَةِ - : وإنَّهُم عَلى‏ مَكانِهِم مِنكَ ، ومَنزِلَتِهِم عِندَكَ ، واستِجماعِ أهوائهِم فيكَ ، وكَثرَةِ طاعَتِهِم لَكَ ، وقِلَّةِ غَفلَتِهِم عَن أمرِكَ ، لَو عايَنوا كُنهَ ما خَفِيَ عَلَيهِم مِنكَ لَحَقَّروا أعمالَهُم ، ولَزَرَوا عَلى‏ أنفُسِهِم ، ولَعَرَفوا أ نَّهُم لَم يَعبُدوكَ حَقَّ عِبادَتِكَ ، ولَم يُطيعوكَ حَقَّ طاعَتِكَ
hadiths.english: 4100. Imam Ali (AS) said in his description of the angels, ‘With all the positions they possess, and with their rank near You and all their love for You, and with their abundant servitude and worship for You, and their lack of ignorance about You, yet if they were to witness the essence of what is hidden about You from them, they would regard their deeds insignificant, they would reproach themselves and would realize that they have not worshipped You as You deserve to be worshipped, and have not obeyed You as You deserve to be obeyed.’

hadiths.arabic: 4101. الإمام زينُ العابدينَ عليه السلام - في الدّعاءِ - : عَجَزَتِ العُقولُ عَن إدراكِ كُنهِ جَمالِكَ ، وانحَسَرَتِ الأبصارُ دونَ‏النَّظَرِ إلى‏ سُبُحاتِ وَجهِكَ، ولَم تَجعَلْ لِلخَلقِ طَريقاً إلى‏ مَعرِفَتِكَ إلّا بِالعَجزِ عَن مَعرِفَتِكَ
hadiths.english: 4101. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said in one of his supplications, ‘The intellects are incapable of fathoming the essence of Your Beauty, the sights are restricted to looking at other than the splendour of Your Countenance, and You have not set aside any means for Your creation to get to know You except through their complete incapacity of knowing You.’

hadiths.arabic: 4102. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : كُنهُهُ تَفريقٌ بَينَهُ وبَينَ خَلقِهِ
hadiths.english: 4102. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, ‘His essence is a partition [distinction] between Him and His creation.’

hadiths.arabic: 4103. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام - في صِفَةِ اللَّهِ سُبحانَهُ - : هُوَ أجَلُّ مِن أن يُدرِكَهُ بَصَرٌ ، أو يُحيطَ بِه وَهمٌ ، أو يَضبِطَهُ عَقلٌ
hadiths.english: 4103. Imam al-Rida (AS) said in his description of Allah, Glory be to Him, ‘He is too exalted for sight to be able to perceive Him, for imagination to be able to fathom Him, and for the intellect to be able to grasp Him.’

sections.section_title_en: THE EXTENT TO WHICH ONE IS ALLOWED TO DESCRIBE ALLAH

hadiths.arabic: 4104. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: مَن وَصَفَهُ فَقَد حَدَّهُ ، ومَن حَدَّهُ فَقَد عَدَّهُ ، ومَن عَدَّهُ فَقَد أبطَلَ أزَلَهُ ، ومَن قالَ : «كَيفَ ؟» فقَدِ استَوصَفَهُ ، ومَن قالَ : «أينَ ؟» فقَد حَيَّزَهُ
hadiths.english: 4104. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He who [undertakes to] describe Him has defined Him, and he who defines Him has numbered Him, and he who numbers Him has nullified His eternity. He who asks ‘How?’ [about Allah] has indeed sought to describe Him, and he who asks ‘Where?’ has indeed confined Him.’

hadiths.arabic: 4105. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : فتَبارَكَ اللَّهُ الّذي لا يَبلُغُهُ بُعدُالهِمَمِ ، ولا يَنالُهُ حَدسُ الفِطَنِ
hadiths.english: 4105. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘So Exalted be the One Whom the highest ambitions cannot reach and Whom the conjecture of intelligent minds cannot grasp.’

hadiths.arabic: 4106. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : واحِدٌ لا بِعَدَدٍ ، ودائمٌ لا بِأمَدٍ ، وقائمٌ لا بِعَمَدٍ
hadiths.english: 4106. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘[He is] One, but not by enumeration. He is everlasting without extremity. He exists without any support.’

hadiths.arabic: 4107. الكافي عن الإمامِ الصّادقِ عليه السلام : قالَ رجلٌ عندهُ : اللَّهُ أكبَرُ، فقالَ : اللَّهُ أكبَرُ مِن أيِّ شَي‏ءٍ ؟ فقالَ : مِن كُلِّ شَي‏ءٍ ، فقالَ أبو عَبدِ اللَّهِ عليه السلام : حَدَّدتَهُ، فقالَ الرَّجُلُ : كَيفَ أقولُ ؟ قالَ : قُل : اللَّهُ أكبَرُ مِن أن يُوصَفَ
hadiths.english: 4107. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) asked a man who said ‘Allah is Greater’ (Allahu Akbar), ‘Greater than what?’ So the man replied, ‘Greater than everything’, to which Imam (AS) retorted, ‘Then you have defined Him.’ The man then asked him, ‘So what should I say?’ Imam replied, ‘Say: Allah is too great for description.’

hadiths.arabic: 4108. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : إنَّ اللَّهَ أعلى‏ وأجَلُّ وأعظَمُ مِن أن يُبلَغَ كُنهُ صِفَتِهِ ، فَصِفُوهُ بِما وَصَفَ بِهِ نَفسَهُ ، وكُفّوا عَمّا سِوى‏ ذلكَ
hadiths.english: 4108. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, ‘Verily Allah is too High and too Exalted and too Great for the reality of His description to ever be possible, so describe Him as He Himself has described Himself, and desist from anything other than that.’

hadiths.arabic: 4109. الإمامُ الهاديُّ عليه السلام : إنّ الخالِقَ لا يُوصَفُ إلّا بِما وَصَفَ بِهِ نَفسَهُ ، وأنّى‏ يُوصَفُ الخالِقُ الّذي تَعجُزُ الحَواسُّ أن تُدرِكَهُ ، والأوهامُ أن تَنالَهُ ، والخَطَراتُ أن تَحُدَّهُ ، والأبصارُ عَنِ الإحاطَةِ بِهِ ؟ ! جلَّ عَمّا يَصِفُهُ الواصِفونَ ، وتَعالى‏ عَمّا يَنعَتُهُ الناعِتونَ
hadiths.english: 4109. Imam al-Hadi (AS) said, ‘Verily the Creator can only be described by that which He Himself has described Himself, and how can the Creator ever be described anyway, Whom the senses are incapable of perceiving and the imaginations unable to grasp and the ideas unable to confine and the sights unable to contain?! He is too exalted for the description of those who undertake to describe, and too high to be attributed by those who seek to attach attributes to Him.’

sections.section_title_en: THE VALUE OF THE BELIEF IN ALLAH’S DIVINE UNITY AND ITS EXPLANATION (TAWhiD)

hadiths.arabic: 4110. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : التَّوحيدُ نِصفُ الدِّينِ
hadiths.english: 4110. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘[Faith in] Allah’s divine Unity is half of religion.’

hadiths.arabic: 4111. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : التَّوحيدُ حَياةُ النَّفسِ
hadiths.english: 4111. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘[Faith in] Allah’s divine Unity is the life of the soul.’

hadiths.arabic: 4112. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : التَّوحيدُ ألّا تَتَوَهَّمَهُ
hadiths.english: 4112. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘[Faith in] Allah’s divine Unity is that you do not subject Him to the limitations of your imagination.’

hadiths.arabic: 4113. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - لِرَجُلٍ - : أمَّا التَّوحيدُ فأن لا تُجوِّزَ عَلى‏ رَبِّكَ ماجازَ عَلَيكَ ، وأمَّا العَدلُ فأن لا تَنسِبَ إلى‏ خالِقِكَ ما لامَكَ عَلَيهِ
hadiths.english: 4113. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘[Faith in] Allah’s divine Unity is that you do not deem applicable to your Lord that which applies to you, and [faith in] His divine Justice is that you do not blame Him for that which you are blameworthy.’

hadiths.arabic: 4114. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : أوَّلُ عِبادَةِ اللَّهِ مَعرِفتُهُ، وأصلُ مَعرِفةِ اللَّهِ جلَّ اسمُهُ تَوحيدُهُ ، ونِظامُ تَوحيدِهِ نَفيُ التَّحديدِ عَنهُ ؛ لِشَهادَةِ العُقولِ أنَّ كلَّ مَحدودٍ مَخلوقٌ
hadiths.english: 4114. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, ‘The very first step to Allah’s worship is to attain inner knowledge of Him, and the origin of attaining inner knowledge of Allah, Exalted be His Praise, is through His divine Unity. The very basis of His divine Unity is to negate any kind of limitation from Him, since the intellects are able to witness that every limited being is created.’

sections.section_title_en: THE PROOF OF ALLAH’S DIVINE UNITY

hadiths.arabic: 4115. الإمامُ‏عليٌّ عليه السلام - في وَصِيَّتِه لِابنِه الحَسَنِ عليه السلام - : واعلَمْ يا بُنَيَّ أ نَّهُ لَو كانَ لِرَبِّكَ شَريكٌ لَأتَتكَ رُسُلُهُ ، ولَرَأيتَ آثارَ مُلكِهِ وسُلطانِهِ ، ولَعَرَفتَ‏أفعالَهُ وصِفاتِهِ، ولكِنَّهُ إلهٌ واحِدٌ كَما وَصَفَ نَفسَهُ ، لا يُضادُّهُ في مُلكِهِ أحَدٌ ، ولا يَزولُ أبَداً
hadiths.english: 4115. Imam Ali (AS) said in his will to his son, al-Hasan (AS), ‘And know my son that if your Lord were to have a partner, his messengers would surely have come to you, and you would have seen the signs of his dominion and his power, and you would know his acts and his attributes. He, however, is One God, just as He as described Himself. He is neither opposed by anyone in His kingdom, nor will He ever cease to be.’

hadiths.arabic: 4117. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - لَمّا سُئلَ عَنِ الدَّليلِ عَلى‏ أنَّ اللَّهَ واحِدٌ - : اتِّصالُ التَّدبيرِ ، وتَمامُ الصُّنعِ ، كَما قالَ اللَّهُ عَزَّوجلَّ : (لَو كانَ فيهِما آلِهَةٌ إلَّا اللَّهُ لَفَسَدَتا)
hadiths.english: 4117. Imam al-Sadiq (AS), when asked to give proof that Allah is One, said, ‘The continuous unity of management [in the cosmos] and the perfection of creation, as Allah, Mighty and Exalted, has said,“Had there been gods in them (i.e. the heavens and the earth) other than Allah, they would surely have fallen apart.”

hadiths.arabic: 4118. التوحيد عن الإمامِ الرِّضا عليه السلام - لَمّا سألَهُ رَجُلٌ مِنَ الثَنَوِيَّةِ : إنّي أقولُ: إنّ صانِعَ العالَمِ اثنانِ ، فما الدَّليلُ عَلى‏ أ نَّهُ واحِدٌ ؟ - : قَولُكَ : إنَّهُ اثنانِ دَليلٌ عَلى‏ أ نَّهُ واحِدٌ ؛ لِأنَّكَ لَم تَدَّعِ الثّانِيَ إلّا بَعدَ إثباتِكَ الواحِدَ ، فالواحِدُ مُجمَعٌ عَلَيهِ ، وأكثَرُ مِن واحِدٍ مُختَلَفٌ فيهِ
hadiths.english: 4118. al-Tawhid, narrating from Imam al-Rida (AS) when a man believing in dualism asked him, ‘I believe that the creator of the world are two, so what is the proof that He is One?’ The Imam replied, ‘Your belief that there are two is proof in itself that He is One, for verily you have only claimed the second after having affirmed the existence of the One. So, the One is already agreed upon –it is more than one that is controversial [and remains to be proven].’

hadiths.arabic: 4119. تفسير القمّي : ثُمّ رَدَّ اللَّهُ عَلَى الثَّنَويَّةِ الّذينَ قالوا بِإلهَينِ فقالَ اللَّهُ تَعالى‏: (ما اتَّخَذَ اللَّهُ مِن وَلَدٍ وما كانَ مَعَهُ مِن إلهٍ ...) قالَ : لَو كانا إلهَينِ كَما زَعَمتُم لَكانا يَختِلفان ؛ فيَخلُقُ هذا ولا يَخلُقُ هذا، ويُريدُ هذا ولا يُريدُ هذا، ويَطلبُ كلُّ واحدٍ مِنهما الغَلَبَةَ، وإذا أرادَ أحدُهُما خَلْقَ إنسانٍ أرادَ الآخرُ خَلْقَ بَهيمَةٍ، فيكونُ إنساناً وبَهيمةً في حالَةٍ واحِدَةٍ ، وهذا غيرُ مَوجودٍ، فَلَمّا بَطُلَ هذا ثَبَتَ التَّدبيرُ والصِنعُ لِواحدٍ، ودَلَّ أيضاً التَّدبيرُ وثباتُهُ وقِوامُ بَعضِهِ بِبَعضٍ على‏ أنَّ الصّانِعَ واحدٌ وذلكَ قَولُهُ : (ما اتَّخَذَ اللَّهُ مِن وَلَدٍ) إلى‏ قَولِهِ : (لَعَلا بَعْضُهُمْ عَلى‏ بَعْضٍ)
hadiths.english: 4119. It is written in Tafsir al-Qummi: ‘Then Allah, Mighty and Exalted, answered dualism and those who professed that there were two gods, saying:“Allah has not taken any offspring, neither is there any god besides Him, for then each god would take away what he created, and some of them would surely rise up against others. Clear is Allah of what they allege!” If there were two gods, as you claim, each one of them would seek superiority, and if one of them desired to create a man, the other would desire to oppose him and create an animal, so their joint creation would have to be the product of both their desires, in spite of their differing wills, man and beast at the same time. And this is the most impossible thing that does not even exist. And if this argument is invalid and there is no difference between them, then the whole duality is invalid [with no distinction left between the two] and there is only one. Therefore, this order, unity of arrangement, subsistence of some things through other things, all indicate to One Maker, and this is the purport of Allah’s verse in the Qur’an:“Allah has not taken any offspring neither is there any god besides Him…” and“Had there been gods in them (i.e. the heavens and the earth) other than Allah, they would surely have fallen apart.”

sections.section_title_en: THE SIGHTS CANNOT APPREHEND HIM BUT THE HEARTS BEHOLD HIM

hadiths.arabic: 4120. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لَمّا اُسرِيَ بي إلَى السَّماءِ بَلَغَ بي جَبرَئيلُ مَكاناً لَم يَطَأْهُ جَبرئيلُ قَطُّ ، فكُشِفَ لي فأرانِيَ اللَّهُ عَزَّوجلَّ مِن نورِ عَظَمَتِهِ ما أحَبَّ
hadiths.english: 4120. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘When I was taken on my Night Journey to the heavens, Gabriel took me up until a place wherein he himself had never set foot. The veils were pulled away for me and Allah, Mighty and Exalted, showed me whatever He liked from the light of His Greatness.’

hadiths.arabic: 4121. الإمامُ‏عليٌّ عليه السلام لِذَعلَب لَمّا سَئَلَهُ عَن رُؤيَتِهِ رَبَّهُ : وَيلَكَ يا ذَعلَبُ ! لَم أكُن بِالّذي أعبُدُ رَبّاً لَم أرَهُ ! قالَ : فكَيفَ رَأيتَهُ ؟ صِفْهُ لَنا ؟ قالَ : وَيلَكَ ! لَم تَرَهُ العُيونُ بِمُشاهَدَةِ الأبصارِ ، ولكِنْ رَأتهُ القُلوبُ بِحَقائقِ الإيمانِ
hadiths.english: 4121. Imam Ali (AS) said in reply to Dhalab’s question about his being able to see his Lord, ‘Woe to you O Dhalab! I do not worship a Lord Whom I cannot see!’ So Dhalab asked, ‘But how do you see Him? Describe Him to us.’ Imam (AS) replied, ‘Woe betide you! Eyes do not see Him by looking with the sights; it is the hearts that behold Him with the realities of faith.’

hadiths.arabic: 4122. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام - في قولِهِ تعالى‏ : (لا تُدرِكُهُ الأبصارُ ...) - : لا تُدرِكُهُ أوهامُ القُلوبِ ، فكَيفَ تُدرِكُهُ أبصارُ العُيونِ ؟ !
hadiths.english: 4122. Imam al-Rida (AS), with regards to Allah’s verse in the Qur’an:“The sights do not apprehend Him…” said, ‘The hearts’ fancies cannot apprehend Him so how can the eyesights apprehend Him?!’

hadiths.arabic: 4123. الإمامُ العسكريُّ عليه السلام : إنَّ اللَّهَ تَبارَكَ وتَعالى‏ أرى‏ رَسولَهُ بِقَلبِهِ مِن نورِ عَظَمَتِهِ ما أحَبَّ
hadiths.english: 4123. Imam al-Askari (AS) said, ‘Verily Allah, Blessed and most High, displayed to His Prophet in his heart, whatever He liked from the light of His Greatness.’

hadiths.arabic: 4124. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الحَمدُ للَّهِ‏ِ الأوَّلِ قَبلَ كُلِّ أوَّلٍ ، والآخِرِ بَعدَ كُلِّ آخِرٍ ، وبِأوَّلِيَّتِهِ وَجَبَ أن لا أوَّلَ لَهُ ، وبآخِرِيَّتِهِ وَجَبَ أن لا آخِرَ لَهُ
hadiths.english: 4124. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Praise be to Allah, the First before every first, and the Last after every last, and His Firstness necessitates that there is no beginning to Him, and His Lastness necessitates that there is no end to Him.’

hadiths.arabic: 4125. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا يَزولُ أبَداً ولَم يَزَلْ ، أوَّلٌ قَبلَ الأشياءِ بِلا أوَّلِيَّةٍ ، وآخِرٌ بَعدَ الأشياءِ بِلا نِهايَةٍ
hadiths.english: 4125. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He never ceases to exist and will always be, the First before all things without a beginning, and the Last after all things without an end.’

hadiths.arabic: 4126. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - وقَد سَألَهُ رَجُلٌ يَهودِيٌّ : مَتى‏ كانَ رَبُّنا عَزَّوجلَّ ؟ - : يا يَهودِيُّ ، (ما كانَ) لَم يَكُنْ رَبُّنا فكانَ ، وإنَّما يُقالُ : «مَتى‏ كانَ» لِشَي‏ءٍ لَم يَكُنْ فكانَ ، هُوَ كائنٌ بِلا كَينونَةِ كائنٍ لَم يَزَلْ لَيسَ لَهُ قَبلٌ ، هُوَ قَبلَ القَبلِ ، وقَبلَ الغايَةِ ، انقَطَعَتْ عَنهُ الغاياتُ ، فهُوَ غايَةُ كُلِّ غايَةٍ
hadiths.english: 4126. Imam Ali (AS) was once asked by a Jew, ‘When did our Lord, Mighty and Exalted, come to be?’, to which he replied, ‘O Jew, It is not that our Lord was not and then came to be, for the question ‘When did x come to be?’ is posed regarding something that is not there and then comes to be. He exists without coming into being; He is ever existing having nothing before Him. He is before ‘before’ itself, before any limit. Limits do not apply to Him for He is the ultimate limit of all limits.’

hadiths.arabic: 4127. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : إنَّ اللَّهَ تَبارَكَ وتَعالى‏ كانَ ولا شَي‏ءَ غَيرُهُ ، نوراً لا ظَلامَ فيهِ ، وصادِقاً لا كِذبَ فيهِ ، وعالِماً لا جَهلَ فيهِ، وحَيّاً لا مَوتَ فيهِ ، وكذلِكَ هُوَ اليَومُ ، وكذلِكَ لا يَزالُ أبَداً
hadiths.english: 4127. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘Verily Allah, Blessed and most High, existed when nothing else did, He is absolute light with no darkness, truthful with no falsehood about Him, all-knowing with no ignorance about Him, ever-living with no death about Him, and He is such today, and thus will He remain forever.’

hadiths.arabic: 4128. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنَّ اللَّهَ عِلمٌ لا جَهلَ فيهِ ، حَياةٌ لا مَوتَ فيهِ ، نورٌ لا ظُلمَةَ فيهِ
hadiths.english: 4128. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Verily Allah is all knowledge with no ignorance about Him, He is all Life without any death around Him, and all Light with no darkness about Him.’

hadiths.arabic: 4129. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : كانَ اللَّهُ حَيّاً بِلا حَياةٍ حادِثَةٍ بَل حَيٌّ لِنَفسِهِ
hadiths.english: 4129. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, ‘Allah is Omnipresent without any external source of life … rather He lives through Himself [is Self-existent].’

hadiths.arabic: 4130. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ولا يَعزُبُ عَنهُ عَدَدُ قَطرِ الماءِ ، ولا نُجومُ السَّماءِ ، ولا سَوافِي الرِّيحِ في الهَواءِ ، ولا دَبيبُ النَّملِ عَلَى الصَّفا ، ولا مَقيلُ الذَّرِّ في اللّيلَةِ الظَّلماءِ ، يَعلَمُ مَساقِطَ الأوراقِ ، وخَفِيَّ طَرْفِ الأحداقِ
hadiths.english: 4130. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The number of droplets of water, or of stars in the sky, or of gusts of wind in the air are not unknown to Him, and neither is the crawling of ants on rocks, nor the settling place of tiny ants in the darkness of the night. He knows the spots where leaves fall and the subtle movement of the pupils of the eyes.’

hadiths.arabic: 4131. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : يَعلَمُ عَجيجَ الوُحوشِ في الفَلَواتِ ، ومَعاصِيَ العِبادِ في الخَلَواتِ ، واختِلافَ النِّينانِ في بحار الأنوار الغامِراتِ ، وتَلاطُمَ الماءِ بِالرِّياحِ العاصِفاتِ
hadiths.english: 4131. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He knows the howls of beasts in the forests, the sins of the people committed in secret, the fish’s frequenting the deep seas and the rising of the waters by tempestuous winds.’

hadiths.arabic: 4132. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : خَرَقَ عِلمُهُ باطِنَ غَيبِ السُّتُراتِ ، وأحاطَ بِغُموضِ عَقائدِ السَّريراتِ
hadiths.english: 4132. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘His knowledge pierces through the inside of unknown secrets and encompasses the innermost beliefs of the hearts.’

hadiths.arabic: 4133. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام: لَم يَزَلْ عالِماً بِما يَكونُ، فعِلمُهُ بِهِ قَبلَ كَونِهِ كعِلمِهِ بِهِ بَعدَ كَونِهِ
hadiths.english: 4133. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘He always knows what is to be, such that His knowledge of it before its coming into being is the same as His knowledge after its coming into being.’

hadiths.arabic: 4134. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - لَمّا سُئلَ عَن عِلمِهِ بِالمَكانِ : أكانَ قَبلَ تَكوينِهِ أم حِينَهُ وبَعدَهُ ؟ - : تَعالَى اللَّهُ ! بَل لَم يَزَلْ عالِماً بِالمَكانِ قَبلَ تَكوينِهِ كَعِلمِهِ بِهِ بَعدَ ما كَوَّنَهُ ، وكَذلِكَ عِلمُهُ بِجَميعِ الأشياءِ كعِلمِهِ بِالمَكانِ
hadiths.english: 4134. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) was once asked about Allah’s knowledge of space [i.e. the concept] and whether He knows it before its coming into existence or during it or after it, to which he replied, ‘Most High is Allah! He always knows space before its conception just as He knows it after He has created it, and such is His knowledge of all things like His knowledge of space.’

hadiths.arabic: 4135. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : والعِلمُ ذاتُه ولا مَعلومَ فلَمَّا أحدَثَ الأشياءَ وكانَ المَعلومُ وَقَعَ العِلمُ مِنهُ عَلَى المَعلومِ
hadiths.english: 4135. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Knowledge is His very essence and not the object of knowing [or a known], and when He created things and the object of knowledge came into existence, knowledge was projected from Him onto the known things.’

hadiths.arabic: 4136. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : عِلمُ اللَّهِ لا يُوصَفُ مِنهُ بِأينَ ، ولا يُوصَفُ العِلمُ مِنَ اللَّهِ بِكَيفَ ، ولا يُفرَدُ العِلمُ مِنَ اللَّهِ ، ولا يُبانُ اللَّهُ مِنهُ ، ولَيسَ بَينَ اللَّهِ وبَينَ عِلمِهِ حَدٌّ
hadiths.english: 4136. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, ‘The knowledge of Allah cannot be defined by where, nor can Allah’s knowledge be described by how. Allah’s knowledge cannot be separated from Him, nor can Allah be distinguished from it, and there is no barrier between Allah and His knowledge.’

hadiths.arabic: 4137. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : وأشهَدُ أ نَّهُ عَدلٌ عَدَلَ ، وحَكَمٌ فَصَلَ
hadiths.english: 4137. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘And I bear witness that He is just and acts justly, and is an arbitrator who decides fairly.’

hadiths.arabic: 4138. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - لَمّا سُئلَ عنِ العَدلِ - : العَدلُ ألّا تَتَّهِمَهُ
hadiths.english: 4138. Imam Ali (AS) when asked about faith in Allah’s divine justice, replied, ‘[Faith in] divine justice is that you do not accuse Him of anything.’

hadiths.arabic: 4139. الإمامُ زينَ العابدينُ عليه السلام - في دُعائهِ يَومَ الأضحى‏ والجُمعَةِ - : وقَد عَلِمتُ أ نَّهُ لَيسَ في حُكمِكَ ظُلمٌ ، ولا في نَقمَتِكَ عَجَلَةٌ ، وإنّما يَعجَلُ مَن يَخافُ الفَوتَ ، وإنَّما يَحتاجُ إلَى الظُّلمِ الضَّعيفُ ، وقَد تَعالَيتَ يا إلهي عَن ذلكَ عُلُوّاً كَبيراً
hadiths.english: 4139. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said in his supplication for Friday and for the ?d al-Adha, ‘But I know that there is no wrong in Your decree and no hurry in Your vengeance. He alone hurries who fears to miss, and only the weak needs to wrong. But You are exalted, my God, high indeed above all that!’

hadiths.arabic: 4140. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - وقد سُئلَ عَن أساسِ الدِّينِ - : التَّوحيدُ والعَدلُ . أمّا التَّوحيدُ فأن لا تُجَوِّزَ عَلى‏ رَبِّكَ ما جازَ عَلَيكَ ، وأمّا العَدلُ فأن لا تَنسِبَ إلى‏ خالِقِكَ ما لامَكَ عَلَيهِ
hadiths.english: 4140. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) was asked about the foundation of religion, to which he replied, ‘[It is faith in] Allah’s divine Unity and divine Justice … [Faith in] Allah’s divine Unity is that you do not deem applicable to your Lord that which applies to you, and [faith in] His divine Justice is that you do not attribute to Him that of which you are blameworthy.’

hadiths.arabic: 4141. التوحيد عن مروان بن مسلم : دَخَلَ ابنُ أبي العَوجاءِ عَلى‏ أبي عَبدِ اللَّهِ عليه السلام فقالَ : ألَيسَ تَزعَمُ أنَّ اللَّهَ خالِقُ كُلِّ شَي‏ءٍ ؟ فقالَ أبو عَبدِاللَّهِ عليه السلام : بَلى‏ ، فقالَ : أنا أخلُقُ ! فقالَ عليه السلام لَهُ : كَيفَ تَخلُقُ ؟ ! فقالَ : اُحدِثُ في المَوضِعِ ثُمّ ألبَثُ عَنهُ فيَصيرُ دَوابَّ فأكونُ أنا الّذي خَلَقتُها ! فقالَ أبو عَبدِ اللَّهِ عليه السلام : ألَيسَ خالِقُ الشَّي‏ءِ يَعرِفُ كَم خَلقُهُ ؟ قالَ : بَلى‏ ، قالَ : فتَعرِفُ الذَّكَرَ مِنها مِنَ الاُنثى‏ ، وتَعرِفُ كَم عُمرُها ؟ فسَكَتَ
hadiths.english: 4141. al-Tawhid: ‘Marwan b. Muslim narrated, ‘Ibn Abi al-Awja? once came to Abu Abdillah [al-Sadiq] (AS) and asked, ‘Is it not true that you claim that Allah is the Creator of all things?’ to which Abu Abdillah (AS) replied, ‘Yes.’ So he retorted, ‘I create!’ So the Imam asked him, ‘How do you create?!’ He replied, ‘I defecate in a place, then wait for it, and it becomes a creature, which I have created!’ So Abu Abdillah (AS) said, ‘Is it not true that the creator of something should know what he has created?’ to which he replied yes. Imam continued, ‘Well do you know the female from the male [of what you have supposedly created], and do you know its lifespan?’ to which he had no answer.’

hadiths.arabic: 4142. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : الحَمدُ للَّهِ‏ِ فاطِرِ الأشياءِ إنشاءً ، ومُبتَدِعِها ابتِداءً بِقُدرَتِهِ وحِكمَتِهِ ، لا مِن شَي‏ءٍ فَيَبطُلَ الاختِراعُ ، ولا لِعِلَّةٍ فلا يَصِحَّ الابتِداعُ ، خَلَقَ ما شاءَ كَيفَ شاءَ
hadiths.english: 4142. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, ‘The Originator of all things from their conception, and their Inventor from the very beginning with His Power and Wisdom, [He creates] not from anything otherwise the very concept of invention would be nullified, nor for any cause otherwise the very concept of origination would be inapplicable. He creates whatever He pleases however He pleases.’

hadiths.arabic: 4143. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - لمّا قيل لَهُ : هل يقدرُ ربُّك على أن يدخل الدنيا في بيضةٍ - : إنَّ اللَّهَ تَبارَكَ وتَعالى‏ لا يُنسَبُ إلَى العَجزِ ، والّذي سَألتَني لا يَكونُ
hadiths.english: 4143. Imam Ali (AS) was once asked, ‘Can your Lord fit the world into an egg?’ to which he replied, ‘Verily Allah, Mighty and Exalted, cannot be attributed with incapacity, but that which you are asking cannot ever be.’

hadiths.arabic: 4144. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنَّ إبليسَ قالَ لِعيسَى ابنِ مَريَمَ عليه السلام : أيَقدِرُ رَبُّكَ عَلى‏ أن يُدخِلَ الأرضَ بَيضَةً ؛ لا يُصغِّرُ الأرضَ ولا يُكَبِّرُ البَيضَةَ ؟ فقالَ عيسى‏ عليه السلام : وَيلَكَ ! إنَّ اللَّهَ لا يُوصَفُ بِعَجزٍ ، ومَن أقدَرُ مِمَّن يُلَطِّفُ الأرضَ ويُعَظِّمُ البَيضَةَ ؟ !
hadiths.english: 4144. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) narrated, ‘Iblis [Satan] asked Jesus son of Mary (AS), ‘Is your Lord capable of fitting the earth inside an egg, without shrinking the earth or enlarging the egg?’ So Jesus (AS) replied, ‘Woe betide you! Verily Allah can never be ascribed with incapacity, and who is there more powerful than the One who can shrink the earth and enlarge the egg [if He so wills]?!

hadiths.arabic: 4145. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: يُخبِرُ لا بِلِسانٍ ولَهَواتٍ، ويَسمَعُ لا بِخُروقٍ وأدَواتٍ ، يَقولُ ولا يَلفِظُ ، ويَحفَظُ ولا يَتَحَفَّظُ يَقولُ لِمَن أرادَ كَونَهُ: «كُنْ» فيَكونُ ، لا بِصَوتٍ يُقرَعُ ، ولا بِنِداءٍ يُسمَعُ ، وإنَّما كَلامُه سُبحانَهُ فِعلٌ مِنهُ ، أنشَأهُ ومَثَّلَهُ ، لَم يَكُنْ مِن قَبلِ ذلكَ كائناً ، ولَو كانَ قَديماً لَكانَ إلهاً ثانِياً
hadiths.english: 4145. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He expresses information but not through a tongue or voice. He listens but not with the holes and organs of hearing. He speaks but does not utter words; He remembers but does not learn… When He wishes to create something, He says to it ‘Be’ and it is, but not through a voice that can strike the ears, nor a calling that can be heard. Rather, His speech, Glory be to Him, is an act of His that He creates and incorporates, which did not exist before, for were it an ever-existing thing it would be a second god.’

hadiths.arabic: 4146. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : إنَّما تَكونُ الأشياءُ بإرادَتِهِ ومَشيئَتِهِ ؛ مِن غَيرِ كلامٍ ، ولا تَرَدُّدٍ في نَفَسٍ ، ولا نُطقٍ بِلِسانٍ
hadiths.english: 4146. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, ‘Verily things come into being solely by His will and His wish; without the need for speech, alternation of breath or utterance with the tongue.’

hadiths.arabic: 4147. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الظّاهِرُ بِعَجائبِ تَدبيرِهِ لِلنّاظِرينَ ، والباطِنُ بِجَلالِ عِزَّتِهِ عَن فِكْرِ المُتَوَهِّمِينَ
hadiths.english: 4147. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He manifests the wonders of His management for the onlookers, but by virtue of the exaltedness of His Might He is Hidden from the imagination of the thinkers.’

hadiths.arabic: 4148. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : ظاهِرٌ لا بِتأويلِ المُباشَرَةِ ، مُتَجَلٍّ لا بِاستِهلالِ رُؤيَةٍ ، باطِنٌ لا بِمُزايَلَةٍ
hadiths.english: 4148. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, ‘He is manifest though indiscernible through direct contact; He is evident though unapprehended by vision; He is hidden though not through withdrawal.’

hadiths.arabic: 4149. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : كُلُّ مالِكٍ غَيرُهُ مَملوكٌ.
hadiths.english: 4149. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Every master other than Him is a slave.’

hadiths.arabic: 4150. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - في تَفسيرِ لا حَولَ ولا قُوَّةَ إلّا بِاللَّهِ - : إنّا لا نَملِكُ مَعَ اللَّهِ شَيئاً ، ولا نَملِكُ إلّا ما مَلَّكَنا ، فمَتى‏ مَلَّكَنا ما هُوَ أملَكُ بِهِ مِنّا كَلَّفَنا ، ومَتى‏ أخَذَهُ مِنّا وَضَعَ تَكليفَهُ عَنّا
hadiths.english: 4150. Imam Ali (AS), in his explanation of the phrase ‘There is no power or strength save in Allah’, said, ‘Verily we are not masters over anything with Allah, nor are we masters over anything except what He has given us mastery over. So by making us masters over that which He is a superior Master, He has given us responsibility, and by taking away mastership from us He absolves us of our responsebilities.’

hadiths.arabic: 4151. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : والسَّميعُ لا بِأداةٍ
hadiths.english: 4151. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He is the All-hearing but not by means of any organ.’

hadiths.arabic: 4152. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : إنَّهُ سَميعٌ بَصيرٌ ، يَسمَعُ بِما يُبصِرُ ، ويُبصِرُ بِما يَسمَعُ
hadiths.english: 4152. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘Verily He is all-hearing and all-seeing, such that He hears with that by means of which He sees and He sees with that by means of which He hears.’

hadiths.arabic: 4153. الإمامُ الرّضا عليه السلام : لَمّا لَم يَخفَ عَلَيهِ خافِيَةٌ مِن أثَرِ الذَّرَّةِ السَّوداءِ ، عَلَى الصَّخرَةِ الصَّمّاءِ ، في اللَّيلَةِ الظَّلماءِ ، تَحتَ الثَّرى‏ وبحار الأنوار ، قُلنا : بَصيرٌ
hadiths.english: 4153. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, ‘Because of the fact that the secret trace of a black mustard seed on a massive rock in the darkness of the night, be it in the ground or in the seas, cannot remain hidden from Him, is what compels us to say that He is all-seeing.’

hadiths.arabic: 4154. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام: أمّا اللَّطيفُ فلَيسَ عَلى‏ قِلَّةٍ وقَضافَةٍ وصِغَرٍ ، ولكِنَّ ذلِكَ عَلَى النَّفاذِ في الأشياءِ ، والامتِناعِ مِن أن يُدرَكَ ، أمّا الخَبيرُ فالّذي لا يَعزُبُ عَنهُ شَي‏ءٌ ولا يَفوتُهُ ، لَيسَ لِلتَّجرِبَةِ ولا لِلاعتِبارِ بِالأشياءِ ، فعِندَ التَّجرِبَةِ والاعتِبارِ عِلمانِ ، ولَولاهُما ما عَلِمَ ؛ لأنَّ مَن كانَ كذلِكَ كانَ جاهِلاً
hadiths.english: 4154. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, ‘He is subtle not in terms of lack or delicateness or smallness, rather [He is subtle] in His [knowledge and power of] penetration into everything without being perceived. He is all-aware through the fact that nothing escapes His attention or evades Him, independent of experience or consideration of things, for experience and consideration in turn result in two types of knowledge, without which He would not know [if he were to be dependent on them], and would therefore be ignorant.’

hadiths.arabic: 4155. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: وكُلُّ قَوِيٍّ غَيرُهُ ضَعيفٌ
hadiths.english: 4155. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘And every strong person besides Allah is weak.’

hadiths.arabic: 4156. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : كُلُّ شَي‏ءٍ خاشِعٌ لَهُ ، وكُلُّ شَي‏ءٍ قائمٌ بِهِ ، غِنى‏ كُلِّ فَقيرٍ ، وعِزُّ كُلِّ ذَليلٍ ، وقُوَّةُ كلِّ ضَعيفٍ
hadiths.english: 4156. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Everything humbles before Him, and everything subsists through Him. He is the contentment of every poor, the honour of every disgraced one, and the strength of every weak one.’

hadiths.arabic: 4157. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : كُلُّ عَزيزٍ غَيرُهُ ذَليلٌ
hadiths.english: 4157. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Every mighty one besides Him is abased.’

hadiths.arabic: 4158. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الحَمدُ للَّهِ‏ِ الّذي لَبِسَ العِزَّ والكِبرِياءَ، واختارَهُما لِنَفسِهِ دُونَ‏خَلقِهِ.
hadiths.english: 4158. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Praise be to Allah who wears the cloak of might and majesty, and has chosen them for Himself over the rest of His creation.’

hadiths.arabic: 4159. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام - لَمّا سُئلَ : وكَيفَ لا يُسألُ عَمّا يَفعَلُ ؟ - : لِأنَّهُ لا يَفعَلُ إلّا ما كانَ حِكمَةً وصَواباً
hadiths.english: 4159. Imam al-Baqir (AS) was once asked why it is that Allah cannot be questioned about what He does, to which he replied, ‘Because He only does what is wise and good.’

hadiths.arabic: 4160. الإمامُ الحسينُ عليه السلام: الصَّمَدُ: الّذي لا جَوفَ لَهُ ، والصَّمَدُ : الّذي قَدِ انتَهى‏ سُؤدَدُهُ ، والصَّمَدُ الّذي لا يَأكُلُ ولا يَشرَبُ ، والصَّمَدُ : الّذي لا يَنامُ ، والصَّمَدُ : الدّائمُ الّذي لَم يَزَلْ ولا يَزالُ
hadiths.english: 4160. Imam al-Husayn (AS) said, ‘The All-embracing is the One Who has no lack within Him; the All-embracing is the One Whose mastership is complete; the All-embracing is the One Who neither eats nor drinks; the All-embracing is the One Who does not sleep; the All-embracing is the Eternal One who is and will always be.’

hadiths.arabic: 4161. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - في صِفَةِ اللَّهِ سُبحانَهُ - : وإنَّهُ لَبِكُلِّ مَكانٍ ، وفي كُلِّ حِينٍ وأوانٍ ، ومَعَ كُلِّ إنسٍ وجانٍّ.
hadiths.english: 4161. Imam Ali (AS) said, describing Allah, Glory be to Him, ‘And verily He is everywhere, each and every moment and time, and with every human and Jinn.’

sections.section_title_en: ATTRIBUTES OF HIS ESSENCE AND ATTRIBUTES OF HIS ACTION

hadiths.arabic: 4163. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : رَبُّنا نورِيُّ الذّاتِ ، حَيُّ الذّاتِ ، عالِمُ الذّاتِ ، صَمَدِيُّ الذّاتِ
hadiths.english: 4163. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Our Lord is luminant in His very essence, Living in His very essence, All-knowing in His very essence, All-embracing in His very essence.’

hadiths.arabic: 4164. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام : المَشيئَةُ والإرادَةُ مِن صِفاتِ الأفعالِ، فمَن زَعَمَ أنَّ اللَّهَ تَعالى‏ لَم يَزَلْ مُريداً شائياً فلَيسَ بِمُوَحِّدٍ
hadiths.english: 4164. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, ‘Wish and will are among the attributes of action, so whoever claims that Allah, most High, is eternally willing and wishing cannot be considered a monotheist.’

hadiths.arabic: 4165. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أوَّلُ الدِّينِ مَعرِفَتُهُ ، وكمالُ مَعرِفَتِهِ التَّصديقُ بِهِ ، وكمالُ التَّصديقِ بِهِ تَوحيدُهُ ، وكَمالُ تَوحيدِهِ الإخلاصُ لَهُ ، وكمالُ الإخلاصِ لَهُ نَفيُ الصِّفاتِ عَنهُ ؛ لِشَهادَةِ كُلِّ صِفَةٍ أ نَّها غَيرُ المَوصوفِ ، وشَهادَةِ كُلِّ مَوصوفٍ أ نَّهُ غَيرُ الصِّفَةِ ، فمَن وَصَفَ اللَّهَ سُبحانَهُ فقَد قَرَنَهُ ، ومَن قَرَنَهُ فقَد ثَنّاهُ ، ومَن ثنّاهُ فَقَد جَزَّأهُ ، ومَن جَزَّأهُ فقَد جَهِلَهُ ، (ومَن جَهِلَهُ فقَد أشارَ إلَيهِ) ، ومَن أشارَ إلَيهِ فقَد حَدَّهُ ، ومَن حَدَّهُ فقَد عَدَّهُ ، ومَن قالَ : «فيمَ ؟» فقَد ضَمَّنَهُ ، ومَن قالَ : «عَلامَ ؟» فقَد أخلى‏ مِنهُ ، كائنٌ لا عَن حَدَثٍ ، مَوجودٌ لا عَن عَدَمٍ ، مَعَ كُلِّ شَي‏ءٍ لا بِمُقارَنَةٍ ، وغَيرُ كُلِّ شَي‏ءٍ لا بِمُزايَلَةٍ ، فاعِلٌ لا بِمَعنَى الحَرَكاتِ والآلَةِ ، بَصيرٌ إذ لا مَنظورَ إلَيهِ مِن خَلقِهِ ، مُتَوحِّدٌ إذ لا سَكَنَ يَستَأنِسُ بِهِ ولا يَستَوحِشُ لِفَقدِهِ
hadiths.english: 4165. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The very first step in religion is acknowledging Him, and the perfect way to acknowledge Him is to testify to Him, and the perfect way to testify to Him is to believe in His divine unity, and the perfect way to believe in His divine unity is to regard Him as absolutely pure, and the perfect way to regard Him as absolutely pure is to negate all attributes from Him, for every attribute is a proof of its own distinction from the thing to which it is attributed, and everything that is attached and attributed is distinct from the attribute. Thus, whoever attaches attributes to Allah, Glory be to Him, associates Him with something else, and whoever associates Him regards Him as two, and whoever regards Him as two identifies parts to Him, and whoever identifies parts to Him has indeed misunderstood Him, and whoever misunderstands Him singles Him out, and whoever singles Him out has confined Him, and whoever confines Him has enumerated Him. Whoever asks ‘In what [is He]?’ holds that He is contained, and whoever asks ‘On what [is He]?’ has excluded Him. He is [a Being] but not through any phenomenon of coming into being, He exists but not from non-existence. He is with everything but not in physical proximity, and is separate from everything but not through physical separation. He acts but without need for movements and instruments. He sees without need for an object of sight from among His creation. He is One such that He has no need for a source of comfort that may keep Him company nor any whom He may miss in his absence.’

hadiths.arabic: 4071. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن عَرَفَ اللَّهَ كَمُلَت مَعرِفتُهُ
hadiths.english: 4071. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He who attains inner knowledge of Allah has achieved perfection in his knowledge indeed.’

hadiths.arabic: 4072. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَعرِفةُ اللَّهِ سُبحانَهُ أعلى‏ المَعارِفِ
hadiths.english: 4072. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The inner knowledge of Allah, Glory be to Him, is the highest of knowable truths.’

hadiths.arabic: 4073. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ما يَسُرُّني لَو مِتُّ طِفلاً واُدخِلتُ الجَنَّةَ ولم أكبُرْ فأعرِفَ رَبّي عَزَّوجلَّ
hadiths.english: 4073. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘I would not be pleased to die as a child and be made to enter Paradise without being able to grow up and get to know my Lord, Mighty and Exalted.’

hadiths.arabic: 4074. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ثَمَرَةُ العِلمِ مَعرِفَةُ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 4074. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The fruit of knowledge is attaining inner knowledge of Allah.’

hadiths.arabic: 4075. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن سَكَنَ قَلبَهُ العِلمُ بِاللَّهِ سَكَنَهُ الغِنى‏ عَن خَلقِ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 4075. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He whose heart finds peace in knowing Allah, finds peace in being needless of Allah’s creatures.’

hadiths.arabic: 4076. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لَو يَعلَمُ النّاسُ ما في فَضلِ مَعرِفةِ اللَّهِ عَزَّوجلَّ ما مَدُّوا أعيُنَهُم إلى‏ ما مَتَّعَ اللَّهُ بِهِ الأعداءَ مِن زَهرَةِ الحَياةِ الدّنيا ونَعيمِها ، وكانَت دُنياهُم أقَلَّ عِندَهُم مِمّا يَطَؤونَهُ بِأرجُلِهِم ، ولَنَعِموا بِمَعرِفةِ اللَّهِ جَلَّ وعزَّ ، وتَلَذَّذوا بِها تَلَذُّذَ مَن لَم يَزَلْ في رَوضاتِ الجِنانِ مَعَ أولِياءِ اللَّهِ إنَّ مَعرِفةَ اللَّهِ عَزَّوجلَّ اُنسٌ مِن كُلِّ وَحشَةٍ ، وصاحِبٌ مِن كُلِّ وَحدَةٍ ، ونُورٌ مِن كُلِّ ظُلمَةٍ ، وقُوَّةٌ مِن كُلِّ ضَعفٍ ، وشِفاءٌ مِن كُلِّ سُقمٍ
hadiths.english: 4076. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘If people knew the virtue of knowing Allah, Mighty and Exalted, they would never extend their gaze to the splendour and bounties of the life of this world that Allah has granted to the enemies. They would then regard such people’s worldly goods to be more insignificant that the dust under their feet, and they would take great pleasure at attaining knowledge of Allah, Mighty and Exalted, and would savour it as if they were tasting the experience of being in the gardens of Paradise with the friends of Allah. Verily the inner knowledge of Allah is an intimate companion in every type of desolation, a friend in every type of loneliness, a light in every darkness, a source of strength from all weakness, and a cure for all ailments.’

hadiths.arabic: 4166. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : فِعلُ المَعروفِ ، وإغاثَةُ المَلهوفِ ، وإقراءُ الضُّيوفِ ، آلَةُ السِّيادَةِ
hadiths.english: 4166. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Performing common acts of courtesy, bringing solace to a grief-stricken person, and being hospitable to guests is the instrument of leadership.’

hadiths.arabic: 4167. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : المَعروفُ ذَخيرَةُ الأبَدِ
hadiths.english: 4167. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Acts of courtesy are treasures for eternity.’

hadiths.arabic: 4168. الإمامُ الحسينُ عليه السلام : اعلَموا أنَّ المَعروفَ مُكِسبٌ حَمداً ، ومُعقِبٌ أجراً ، فلَو رَأيتُمُ المَعروفَ رَجُلاً لَرَأيتُموهُ حَسَناً جَميلاً يَسُرُّ النّاظِرينَ ويَفوقُ العالَمينَ ، ولَو رَأيتُمُ اللُّؤمَ رَأيتُموهُ سَمِجاً قَبيحاً مَشوماً تَنفِرُ مِنهُ القُلوبُ وتُغَضُّ دُونَهُ الأبصارُ
hadiths.english: 4168. Imam al-Husayn (AS) said, ‘Know that acts of courtesy earn praiseworthy results, and end in rewardable gains. If you were to see acts of courtesy personified as a man, you would perceive him to be good and handsome, pleasing for people to behold and transcending all the worlds. And if you were to see acts of vileness personified, you would perceive an ugly, revolting, disfigured man, whom the hearts would be averse to and whom the eyes would turn away from in disgust.’

hadiths.arabic: 4169. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : أوَّلُ مَن يَدخُلُ الجَنَّةَ أهلُ المَعروفِ
hadiths.english: 4169. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘The first people to enter Paradise will be those who performed acts of common courtesy to others.’

hadiths.arabic: 4170. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام: أهلُ المَعروفِ في الدّنيا هُم أهلُ المَعروفِ في الآخِرَةِ ؛ لأِ نَّهُم في الآخِرَةِ تَرجَحُ لَهُمُ الحَسَناتُ ، فيَجودونَ بِها عَلى‏ أهلِ المَعاصي
hadiths.english: 4170. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘The people who perform acts of courtesy in this world will be the same ones to perform them in the Hereafter, for verily in the Hereafter their scales will be so laden with their good deeds that they will be able to bestow them generously on the sinners [in order to assist them].’

hadiths.arabic: 4171. الإمامُ الجوادُ عليه السلام : أهلُ المَعروفِ إلَى اصطِناعِه أحوَجُ مِن أهلِ الحاجَةِ إلَيهِ ؛ لأِنَّ لَهُم أجرَهُ وفَخرَهُ وذِكرَهُ ، فمَهما اصطَنَعَ الرَّجُلُ مِن مَعروفٍ فإنَّما يَبدأ فيهِ بِنَفسِهِ ، فلا يَطلُبَنَّ شُكرَ ما صَنَعَ إلى‏ نَفسِهِ مِن غَيرِهِ
hadiths.english: 4171. Imam al-Jawad (AS) said, ‘People who perform acts of courtesy towards others benefit more from them than the receptors of their kindness, for verily they have the reward for them, the [rewarding feeling of] pride for having helped someone as well as a mention. So however much good a man may do for others, it ultimately always starts by benefiting himself, and hence he never seeks thanks for the benefit incurred by himself through helping others.’

sections.section_title_ar: الحَثُّ عَلى‏ بَذلِ المَعروفِ إلَى البَرِّ وَالفاجِرِ
sections.section_title_en: ENJOINMENT OF SPREADING KINDNESS TO BOTH GOOD AND BAD PEOPLE

hadiths.arabic: 4172. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : رَأسُ العَقلِ بَعدَ الدِّينِ التَّوَدُّدُ إلَى النّاسِ ، واصطِناعُ الخَيرِ إلى‏ كُلِّ بَرٍّ وفاجِرٍ
hadiths.english: 4172. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘The peak of good reason after religious devotion is treating people with love, and doing good to both good and bad people.’

hadiths.arabic: 4173. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : اصطَنِعِ الخَيرَ إلى‏ مَن هُوَ أهلُهُ ، وإلى‏ مَن هُوَ غَيرُ أهلِهِ ، فإن لَم تُصِبْ مَن هُوَ أهلُهُ فأنتَ أهلُهُ
hadiths.english: 4173. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Perform acts of courtesy to those who are worthy of them as well as those who are not worthy of them, and even if they have no effect on those who deserve them, you are at least worthy of [performing] them.’

sections.section_title_en: CIRCULATION OF GOOD ACTS FROM HAND TO HAND

hadiths.arabic: 4174. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن تَصَدَّقَ بِصَدَقَةٍ عَلى‏ رَجُلٍ مِسكينٍ كانَ لَهُ مِثلُ أجرِهِ ، ولَو تَداوَلَها أربَعونَ ألفَ إنسانٍ ثُمّ وَصَلَت إلى‏ مِسكينٍ كانَ لَهُم أجراً كامِلاً
hadiths.english: 4174. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘He who offers charity to a poor man gets the reward befitting the action, but if forty thousand people pass the same offering from hand to hand until it reaches the poor man, they all receive a complete reward for it.’

hadiths.arabic: 4175. الإمام الصّادقُ عليه السلام : لَو جَرَى المَعروفُ عَلى‏ ثَمانينَ كَفّاً لَاُجِروا كُلُّهُم فيهِ ، مِن غَيرِ أن يُنقَصَ صاحِبُهُ مِن أجرِهِ شَيئاً
hadiths.english: 4175. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘If an act of charity [or courtesy] goes through eighty changes of hands, all of them receive the reward for it, without any decrease in the reward of the initiating good-doer.’

sections.section_title_en: PROHIBITION OF MAKING SOMEONE FEEL OBLIGED FOR AN ACT OF COURTESY

hadiths.arabic: 4176. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: أحْيِ مَعروفَكَ بِإماتَتِهِ
hadiths.english: 4176. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Give life to your act of courtesy by killing it [i.e. by killing your expectation of receiving anything in return].’

hadiths.arabic: 4177. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : إذا صُنِعَ إلَيكَ مَعروفٌ فَاذكُرْ ، إذا صَنَعتَ مَعروفاً فَانْسَهُ
hadiths.english: 4177. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘If an act of courtesy is done unto you, then be sure to remember it, and if you do an act of courtesy unto someone else, then be sure to forget it.’

hadiths.arabic: 4178. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: مِلاكُ المَعروفِ تَركُ المَنِّ بِهِ
hadiths.english: 4178. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The yardstick [used to measure the goodness] of an act of courtesy is the absence of expectation accompanying it.’

hadiths.arabic: 4179. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله: استِتمامُ المَعروفِ أفضَلُ مِنِ ابتِدائهِ
hadiths.english: 4179. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Bringing a good act to completion is better than [merely] initiating it.’

hadiths.arabic: 4180. الإمام عليٌّ عليه السلام: مَن لَم يُرَبِّ مَعروفَهُ فقَد ضَيَّعَهُ
hadiths.english: 4180. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘One who does not sustain his good action loses it.’

hadiths.arabic: 4181. الإمامُ الكاظمُ عليه السلام : الصَّنيعَةُ لا تَتِمُّ صَنيعَةً عِندَ المُؤمِنِ لِصاحِبِها إلّا بِثَلاثَةِ أشياءَ : تَصغيرِها ، وسَترِها ، وتَعجيلِها ، فمَن صَغَّرَ الصَّنيعَةَ عِندَ المُؤمِنِ فقَد عَظَّمَ أخاهُ ، ومَن عَظَّمَ الصَّنيعَةَ عِندَهُ فقَد صَغَّرَ أخاهُ ، ومَن كَتَمَ ما أولاهُ مِن صَنيعِهِ فقَد كَرَّمَ فِعالَهُ ، ومَن عَجَّلَ ما وَعَدَ فقَد هَنِئَ العَطِيَّةَ
hadiths.english: 4181. Imam al-Kazim (AS) said, ‘A good favour done to a fellow believer is not considered complete until accompanied by three things: underestimation of the act, concealing it, and hastening its completion. He who underestimates his good turn to a fellow believer has esteemed his brother highly indeed, whereas he who esteems his good turn to be great has deemed his brother to be insignificant. He who conceals the good turn that he has done has honoured his action, and he who hastens to fulfil his promise takes pleasure in the gift too.’

sections.section_title_en: PROHIBITION OF HOLDING ACTS OF COMMON COURTESY IN CONTEMPT

hadiths.arabic: 4182. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لا تُحَقِّرَنَّ شَيئاً مِنَ المَعروفِ ، ولَو أن تَلقى‏ أخاكَ ووَجهُكَ مَبسوطٌ إلَيهِ
hadiths.english: 4182. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Never underestimate any act of common courtesy, even simply meeting a fellow brother with a face displaying pleasure at seeing him.’

hadiths.arabic: 4183. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا تَستَصغِر شَيئاً مِنَ المَعروفِ قَدَرتَ عَلَى اصطِناعِه إيثاراً لِما هُوَ أكثَرُ مِنهُ ؛ فإنَّ اليَسيرَ في حالِ الحاجَةِ إلَيهِ أنفَعُ لأِهلِهِ مِن ذلكَ الكَثيرِ في حالِ الغَناءِ عَنهُ ، واعمَلْ لِكُلِّ يَومٍ بِما فيهِ تَرشُدُ
hadiths.english: 4183. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Never deem any act of common courtesy that you are able to carry out as insignificant in comparing it to a greater act, for verily the simple act performed when the need for it arises is more beneficial to its receptor than the great act for which there is no need. Perform for each day good acts that befit it and you will grow on the right course.’

sections.section_title_en: The Mark of Acceptance of A GOOD ACT

hadiths.arabic: 4184. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : خَيرُ المَعروفِ ما اُصيبَ بِهِ الأبرارُ
hadiths.english: 4184. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The best act of common courtesy is that which good people are able to benefit from.’

hadiths.arabic: 4185. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - لَمّا سُئلَ عَن عَلامَةِ قَبولِ العَبدِ عِندَ اللَّهِ - : عَلامَةُ قَبولِ العَبدِ عِندَ اللَّهِ أن يُصيبَ بِمَعروفِهِ مَواضِعَهُ ، فإن لَم يَكُن كذلكَ فلَيسَ كذلكَ
hadiths.english: 4185. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) was once asked what the mark of acceptance of a servant with Allah is, to which he replied, ‘The mark of acceptance of a servant with Allah is that his good acts reach the objects of their intention. If not, then that is not the case.’

hadiths.arabic: 4186. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن قادَ ضَريراً أربَعينَ خُطوَةً عَلى‏ أرضٍ سَهلَةٍ ، لا يَفي بِقَدرِ إبرَةٍ مِن جَميعِهِ طِلاعُ الأرضِ ذَهَباً ، فإن كانَ فيما قادَهُ مَهلَكَةٌ جَوَّزَهُ عَنها وَجَدَ ذلكَ في ميزانِ حَسَناتِهِ يَومَ القِيامَةِ أوسَعَ مِنَ الدّنيا مِائةَ ألفِ مَرَّةٍ
hadiths.english: 4186. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘He who leads a blind man forty steps on level ground, even if he was to be rewarded the whole world’s worth of gold, it would not be enough to recompense a needle’s worth of what that act deserves. And if there is a danger on the path which he averts him from, he will find that act on the Day of Resurrection within his balance of good deeds, larger than one hundred thousand times the expanse of the earth.’

hadiths.arabic: 4187. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : دَخَلَ عَبدٌ الجَنَّةَ بِغُصنٍ مِن شَوكٍ كانَ عَلى‏ طَريقِ المُسلِمينَ فأماطَهُ عَنهُ
hadiths.english: 4187. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘A servant [of Allah] entered Paradise because of a thorn branch that he removed from the path of fellow Muslims.’

hadiths.arabic: 4188. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن بَنى‏ عَلى‏ ظَهرِ الطَّريقِ ما يَأوي عابِرَ سَبيلٍ بَعَثَهُ اللَّهُ يَومَ القِيامَةِ عَلى‏ نَجيبٍ مِن دُرٍّ ، ووَجهُه يُضي‏ءُ لأِهلِ الجَنَّةِ نوراً
hadiths.english: 4188. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘He who builds a structure on the road affording shelter to a traveller, Allah will raise him on the Day of Resurrection mounted on a fine-bred camel adorned with pearls, and his face will radiate light for all the dwellers of Paradise.’

hadiths.arabic: 4189. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن رَدَّ عَن قَومٍ مِنَ المُسلِمينَ عادِيةَ ماءٍ أو نارٍ وَجَبَت لَهُ الجَنَّةُ
hadiths.english: 4189. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘He who averts an impediment of water or fire from a group of Muslims becomes deserving of obligatory entrance into Paradise.’

hadiths.arabic: 4190. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : رَأيتُ المَعروفَ كَاسمِهِ، ولَيسَ شَي‏ءٌ أفضَلَ مِنَ المَعروفِ إلّا ثَوابَهُ
hadiths.english: 4190. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘I have witnessed the act of common courtesy to be exactly as its name suggests, and nothing excels the act of common courtesy than its own reward.’

sections.section_title_ar: أهَمِّيَّةُ الأمرِ بِالمَعروفِ وَالنَّهيِ عَنِ المُنكَرِ
sections.section_title_en: IMPORTANCE OF ENJOINING GOOD AND PROHIBITING WRONG

hadiths.arabic: 4191. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن أمَرَ بِالمَعروفِ ونَهى‏ عَنِ المُنكَرِ فهُوَ خَليفَةُ اللَّهِ في الأرضِ ، وخَليفَةُ رَسولِهِ
hadiths.english: 4191. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Whoever enjoins good and prohibits wrong is the deputy of Allah and the deputy of His Prophet on the earth.’

hadiths.arabic: 4192. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : إنَّ اللَّهَ تَبارَكَ وتَعالى‏ لَيُبغِضُ المُؤمِنَ الضَّعيفَ الّذي لا زَبْرَ لَهُ ، وقالَ : هُوَ الّذي لا يَنهى‏ عَنِ المُنكَرِ
hadiths.english: 4192. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Verily Allah, Mighty and Exalted, despises the weak believer who has no religion [i.e. has no devotion to his religion].’ When asked who a believer with no religion is, he replied, ‘He who does not prohibit wrong.’

hadiths.arabic: 4193. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : قِوامُ الشَّريعَةِ الأمرُ بِالمَعروفِ، والنَّهيُ عَنِ المُنكَرِ ، وإقامَةُ الحُدودِ
hadiths.english: 4193. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The basis of Islamic law is the enjoinment of good and the prohibition of wrong.’

hadiths.arabic: 4194. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : وما أعمالُ البِرِّ كُلُّها والجِهادُ في سَبيلِ اللَّهِ عِندَ الأمرِ بِالمَعروفِ والنَّهيِ عَنِ المُنكَرِ ، إلّا كَنَفثَةٍ في بَحرٍ لُجِّيٍّ
hadiths.english: 4194. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘All acts of righteousness and striving in the way of Allah are as mere spittle in the deep sea compared to enjoining good and prohibiting wrong.’

hadiths.arabic: 4195. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الأمرُ بِالمَعروفِ أفضَلُ أعمالِ الخَلقِ
hadiths.english: 4195. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Enjoinment of good is the best of all acts performed by creation.’

hadiths.arabic: 4196. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اعلَموا أنَّ الأمرَ بِالمَعروفِ والنَّهيَ عَنِ‏المُنكَرِلَم يُقَرِّبا أجَلاً ، ولَم يَقطَعارِزقاً
hadiths.english: 4196. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Know that enjoinment of good and prohibition of wrong never reach an end, and never cut off sustenance.’

hadiths.arabic: 4197. الإمامُ الحسينُ عليه السلام : كانَ يُقالُ : لا تَحِلُّ لِعَينٍ مُؤمِنَةٍ تَرَى اللَّهَ يُعصى‏ فتَطرِفُ حتّى‏ يُغَيِّرَهُ
hadiths.english: 4197. Imam al-Husayn (AS) said, ‘It is not permissible for a believing eye to watch Allah being disobeyed and close without first changing the situation.’

hadiths.arabic: 4198. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : إنَّ الأمرَ بِالمَعروفِ والنَّهيَ عَنِ المُنكَرِ سَبيلُ الأنبياءِ ، ومِنهاجُ الصُّلَحاءِ ، فريضَةٌ عَظيمَةٌ بِها تُقامُ الفَرائضُ ، وتَأمَنُ المَذاهِبُ ، وتَحِلُّ المَكاسِبُ ، وتُرَدُّ المَظالِمُ ، وتَعمُرُ الأرضُ ، ويُنتَصَفُ مِنَ الأعداءِ ، ويَستَقيمُ الأمرُ
hadiths.english: 4198. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘Verily the enjoinment of good and the prohibition of wrong is the path of the prophets, the way of the righteous, a great obligation on which all other obligations are founded and on which ideologies are secured, by which earnings are made lawful, by which iniquities are redressed, through which the earth flourishes, justice is sought from enemies and all affairs are kept upright.’

sections.section_title_ar: خَطَرُ تَركِ الأمرِ بِالمَعروفِ وَالنَّهيِ عَنِ المُنكَرِ
sections.section_title_en: THE DANGER OF ABANDONING the Enjoinment of Good and THE PROHIBITION OF WRONG

hadiths.arabic: 4199. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : لَتَأمُرُنَّ بِالمَعروفِ ولَتَنهُنَّ عَنِ المُنكَرِ ، أو لَيَعُمَّنَّكُم عَذابُ اللَّهِ
hadiths.english: 4199. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘You must enjoin good indeed and you shall prohibit wrong otherwise the chastisement of Allah will surely overtake you.’

hadiths.arabic: 4200. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - مِن وَصِيَّتِهِ لِلحَسَنَينِ عليهما السلام بعدَ أن ضَرَبَهُ ابنُ مُلجَمٍ - : لا تَترُكوا الأمرَ بِالمَعروفِ والنَّهيَ عَنِ المُنكَرِ فَيُوَلّى‏ عَلَيكُم شِرارُكُم ثُمَّ تَدعونَ فلا يُستَجابُ لَكُم
hadiths.english: 4200. Imam Ali (AS) said in his last will to Imam Hasan and Imam Husayn (AS) after he had been struck by Ibn Muljim, ‘Never abandon the enjoinment of good and the prohibittion of wrong lest the evil ones amongst you gain mastery over you whereafter you will supplicate [Allah] but you will not be answered.’

sections.section_title_en: HE WHO CONTENTS HIMSELF WITH A PEOPLE’S (WRONG) ACTION

hadiths.arabic: 4201. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الرّاضي بِفِعلِ قومٍ كالدّاخِلِ فيهِ مَعَهُم ، وعَلى‏ كُلِّ داخِلٍ في باطِلٍ إثمانِ : إثمُ العَمَلِ بِهِ ، وإثمُ الرِّضا بِهِ
hadiths.english: 4201. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The one who contents himself with the wrong action of a group of people is as one who plunges into it with them, and every person who plunges into wrongdoing is guilty of two sins: the sin of having committed the wrong and the sin of being content with it.’

hadiths.arabic: 4202. الإمامُ الجوادُ عليه السلام : مَنِ استَحسَنَ قَبيحاً كانَ شَريكاً فيهِ
hadiths.english: 4202. Imam al-Jawad (AS) said, ‘He who approves of a wicked deed partakes in it.’

hadiths.arabic: 4203. الإمامُ الجوادُ عليه السلام : مَن شَهِدَ أمراً فكَرِهَهُ كانَ كمَن غابَ عَنهُ ، ومَن غابَ عَن أمرٍ فرَضِيَهُ كانَ كمَن شَهِدَهُ
hadiths.english: 4203. Imam al-Jawad (AS) said, ‘He who witnesses a misdeed and abhors it is as one who was absent thereat, whereas he who is absent from a misdeed and yet contents himself with it is as one who witnessed it.’

sections.section_title_en: THE CONDITIONS TO BE OBSERVED BY ONE WHO ENJOINS GOOD

hadiths.arabic: 4204. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن أمَرَ بِمَعروفٍ فليَكُنْ أمرُهُ ذلكَ بِمَعروفٍ
hadiths.english: 4204. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘One who enjoins good should do so using good means.’

hadiths.arabic: 4205. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله - لَمّا قيلَ لَهُ : لا نَأمُرُ ولا نَنهى‏ إلّا بِما عَمِلنا بِهِ أو انتَهَينا عَنهُ كُلِّهِ - : لا ، بَل مُروا بِالمَعروفِ وإن لَم تَعمَلوا بِهِ كُلِّهِ، وانهَوا عَنِ المُنكَرِ وإن لَم تَنتَهوا عَنهُ كُلِّهِ.
hadiths.english: 4205. The Prophet (SAWA) was once told, ‘We only enjoin that which we ourselves practice absolutely and we only prohibit that which we refrain from absolutely’, to which he replied, ‘No, rather enjoin good even if you yourself do not practice it absolutely and prohibit wrong even if you yourself do not refrain from it absolutely.’

hadiths.arabic: 4206. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام: إنّي لأَرفَعُ نَفسي أن أنهى‏ النّاسَ عَمّا لَستُ أنتَهي عَنهُ ، أو آمُرَهُم بِما لا أسبِقُهُم إلَيهِ بعَمَلي
hadiths.english: 4206. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Verily, it is below my dignity to prohibit people from that which I myself do not refrain from, or to enjoin them that which I myself have not performed before them.’

hadiths.arabic: 4207. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لَعَنَ اللَّهُ الآمِرينَ بِالمَعروفِ التّارِكينَ لَهُ ، والنّاهينَ عَنِ المُنكَرِ العامِلينَ بِهِ
hadiths.english: 4207. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Allah curses those who enjoin good but abandon its practice, and those who prohibit wrong but commit it themselves.’

hadiths.arabic: 4208. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : وانهَوا عَنِ المُنكَرِ وتَناهَوا عَنهُ ؛ فإنَّما اُمِرتُم بِالنَّهيِ بَعدَ التّناهي
hadiths.english: 4208. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘And prohibit wrong and abstain from it yourselves, for verily you have been commanded to prohibit wrong after abstention from it.’

hadiths.arabic: 4209. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : إنَّما يَأمُرُ بِالمَعروفِ ويَنهى‏ عَنِ المُنكَرِ مَن كانَت فيهِ ثَلاثُ خِصالٍ : عامِلٌ بِما يَأمُرُ بِهِ وتارِكٌ لِما يَنهى‏ عَنهُ ، عادِلٌ فيما يَأمُرُ عادِلٌ فيما يَنهى‏ ، رَفيقٌ فيما يَأمُرُ ورَفيقٌ فيما يَنهى‏
hadiths.english: 4209. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Verily the one who enjoins good and prohibits wrong should possess three qualities: he should act upon that which he enjoins and abstain from that which he prohibits; he must be just with regards to what he enjoins and just with regards to what he prohibits; and he must be gentle in what he enjoins and gentle in what he prohibits.’

sections.section_title_en: THE LOWEST LEVEL OF PROHIBITION OF WRONG

hadiths.arabic: 4210. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن رَأى‏ مِنكُم مُنكَراً فَلْيُغَيِّرْهُ بِيَدِهِ ، فإن لَم يَستَطِعْ فبِلِسانِهِ ، فإن لَم يَستَطِعْ فبِقَلبِهِ وذلكَ أضعَفُ الإيمانِ
hadiths.english: 4210. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘He who sees wrong being done should redress the situation with his own hand, and if he cannot do so then with his tongue, and if he cannot do so then with his heart [disapproving the act], and that is the weakest level of faith.’

hadiths.arabic: 4211. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : ألا لا يَمنَعَنَّ أحَدَكُم هَيبَةُ النّاسِ أن يَقولَ الحَقَّ إذا رَآهُ أن يَذَّكَّرَ بِعِظَمِ اللَّهِ ، لا يُقَرِّبُ مِن أجَلٍ ولا يُبعِدُ مِن رِزقٍ
hadiths.english: 4211. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Indeed fear of people must not prevent any of you from speaking the truth when he sees it fit to remind others of the grandeur of Allah, for neither will it [i.e. speaking the truth] hasten your destined end, nor will it ward off your decreed sustenance.’

hadiths.arabic: 4212. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن تَرَكَ إنكارَ المُنكَرِ بقَلبِهِ ويَدِهِ ولِسانِهِ فهُوَ مَيِّتٌ بَينَ الأحياءِ
hadiths.english: 4212. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He who abandons the prohibition of wrong with his heart, his hand and his tongue is a dead man walking amongst the living.’

hadiths.arabic: 4213. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : أمَرَنا رَسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله أن نَلقى‏ أهلَ المَعاصي بِوُجوهٍ مُكفَهِرَّةٍ
hadiths.english: 4213. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘The Prophet (SAWA) commanded us to meet the sinners with stern faces.’

hadiths.arabic: 4214. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : حَسبُ المُؤمِنِ عِزّاً إذا رَأى‏ مُنكَراً أن يَعلَمَ اللَّهُ عَزَّوجلَّ مِن قَلبِه إنكارَهُ
hadiths.english: 4214. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘It is honour indeed for a believer that when he sees wrong being done, Allah, Mighty and Exalted, knows his heart to have rejected it.’

hadiths.arabic: 4215. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : العَزيزُ بِغَيرِ اللَّهِ ذَليلٌ
hadiths.english: 4215. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Anyone honoured by other than Allah is actually disgraced.’

hadiths.arabic: 4216. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اِعلَمْ أ نَّهُ لا عِزَّ لِمَن لا يَتَذَلَّلُ للَّهِ‏ِ ، ولا رِفعَةَ لِمَن لا يَتَواضَعُ للَّهِ‏ِ
hadiths.english: 4216. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Know that the one who does not abase himself in front of Allah has no honour, and that the one who does not humble himself before Allah has no elevation.’

hadiths.arabic: 4217. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ولا عِزَّ كَالحِلمِ
hadiths.english: 4217. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘There is no honour like clemency.’

hadiths.arabic: 4218. الإمامُ زينَ العابدينُ عليه السلام : طاعَةُ وُلاةِ الأمرِ تَمامُ العِزِّ
hadiths.english: 4218. Imam Zayn al-Abidin (AS) said, ‘Obedience to the [divinely appointed] authorities of command is a completion of one’s honour.’

hadiths.arabic: 4219. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : العِزُّ أن تَذِلَّ لِلحَقِّ إذا لَزِمَكَ
hadiths.english: 4219. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Honour is to submit oneself to the truth when it comes to you.’

hadiths.arabic: 4220. بحار الأنوار : أوحَى اللَّهُ تَعالى‏ إلى‏ داوودَ عليه السلام : يا داوودُ ، إنّي وَضَعتُ العِزَّ في طاعَتي ، وهُم يَطلُبونَهُ في خِدمَةِ السُّلطانِ فلا يَجِدونَهُ
hadiths.english: 4220. It is narrated in Bihar al-Anwar: Allah, most High, revealed to Prophet David (AS) said, ‘O David, verily … I have placed honour in My obedience whilst they seek it in servitude to the ruler and do not find it therefore.’

hadiths.arabic: 4221. لقمانُ عليه السلام - لِابنِه وهُوَ يَعِظُهُ - : إن أردتَ أن تَجمَعَ عِزَّ الدّنيا فَاقطَعْ طَمَعَكَ مِمّا في أيدي النّاسِ ؛ فإنَّما بَلَغَ الأنبِياءُ والصِّدِّيقونَ ما بَلَغوا بِقَطعِ طَمَعِهِم
hadiths.english: 4221. Luqman (AS) said to his son, exhorting him, ‘If you want to attract honour in this world, then cut off your greed of drawing advantage from what other people have in their possession; for verily the prophets and the veracious ones achieved what they did by cutting off their greed.’

hadiths.arabic: 4222. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : لا عِزَّ أعَزُّ مِنَ التَّقوى‏
hadiths.english: 4222. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘There is no honour higher than piety.’

hadiths.arabic: 4223. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - في المُناجاةِ - : إلهي كَفى‏ لي عِزّاً أن أكونَ لَكَ عَبداً ، وكَفى‏ بي فَخراً أن تَكونَ لي رَبّاً
hadiths.english: 4223. Imam Ali (AS) said in his intimate supplication, ‘My God, it is honour enough for me that I am Your servant, and it is a source of pride for me that You are my Lord.’

hadiths.arabic: 4224. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : ألا إنَّهُ مَن يُنصِفُ النّاسَ مِن نَفسِهِ لَم يَزِدْهُ اللَّهُ إلّا عِزّاً
hadiths.english: 4224. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Know that verily the one who treats people fairly in spite of himself is only increased by Allah in honour.’

hadiths.arabic: 4225. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : اِقنَعْ تَعِزَّ
hadiths.english: 4225. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Be content and you will attain honour.’

hadiths.arabic: 4226. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : اليَأسُ مِمّا في أيدي النّاسِ عِزُّ للمُؤمِنِ في دِينِهِ
hadiths.english: 4226. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘Giving up all hope of benefit from what people possess is an honour for a believer in his religion.’

hadiths.arabic: 4227. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : ثَلاثٌ لا يَزيدُ اللَّهُ بِهِنَّ المَرءَ المُسلِمَ إلّا عِزّاً : الصَّفحُ عَمَّن ظَلَمَهُ ، وإعطاءُ مَن حَرَمَهُ ، والصِّلَةُ لِمَن قَطَعَهُ
hadiths.english: 4227. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘There are three things through which Allah only increases the Muslim in honour: his pardon of one who has wronged him, his giving one who has deprived him, and his reconciliation with one who has cut him off.’

hadiths.arabic: 4228. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : مَن أرادَ عِزّاً بِلا عَشيرَةٍ ، وغِنىً بِلا مالٍ ، وهَيبَةً بِلا سُلطانٍ ، فَلْيُنقَلْ مِن ذُلِّ مَعصِيَةِ اللَّهِ إلى‏ عِزِّ طاعَتِهِ
hadiths.english: 4228. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘He who wishes for honour without noble lineage, wealth without riches and dignity without rulership should remove himself from the disgrace of Allah’s disobedience to the honour of His obedience.’

hadiths.arabic: 4229. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : ما مِن عَبدٍ كَظَمَ غَيظاً إلّا زادَهُ اللَّهُ عَزَّوجلَّ عِزّاً في الدّنيا والآخِرَةِ
hadiths.english: 4229. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘Every single servant who swallows his anger is increased in honour by Allah, Mighty and Exalted, in this world and in the Hereafter.’

hadiths.arabic: 4230. الإمامُ العسكريُّ عليه السلام : ما تَرَكَ الحَقَّ عَزيزٌ إلّا ذَلَّ ، ولا أخَذَ بِهِ ذَليلٌ إلّا عَزَّ
hadiths.english: 4230. Imam al-Askari (AS) said, ‘No sooner does an honourable man abandon the truth than he is abased, and no sooner does a disgraced man adopt it than he is honoured.’

sections.section_title_en: THAT WHICH CAUSES HONOUR TO LAST

hadiths.arabic: 4231. الإمامُ الباقرُ عليه السلام : اُطلُب بَقاءَ العِزِّ بإماتَةِ الطَّمَعِ
hadiths.english: 4231. Imam al-Baqir (AS) said, ‘Seek for everlasting honour through killing greed.’

hadiths.arabic: 4232. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : حِشمَةُ الانقِباضِ أبقى‏ لِلعِزِّ من اُنسِ التَّلاقي
hadiths.english: 4232. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘The modesty in one’s reservation preserves one’s honour longer than the intimacy of encounter [when interacting with people].’

hadiths.arabic: 4233. الكافي : مِمّا ناجَى اللَّهُ تَعالى‏ بِهِ موسى‏ : كُن خَلَقَ الثِّيابِ جَديدَ القَلبِ ، تَخفى‏ عَلى‏ أهلِ الأرضِ ، وتُعرَفُ في أهلِ السَّماءِ
hadiths.english: 4233. It is narrated in al-Kafi: ‘Allah conversed with Prophet Moses saying, ‘Be clad in threadbare clothes though having a clean, fresh heart. Be unknown to the people of the earth, though famous among those in the heavens.’

hadiths.arabic: 4234. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : العُزلَةُ عِبادَةٌ
hadiths.english: 4234. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Solitude is worship.’

hadiths.arabic: 4235. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : الانفِرادُ راحَةُ المُتَعَبِّدينَ
hadiths.english: 4235. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Seclusion is the comfort of the devoted worshippers.’

hadiths.arabic: 4236. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَنِ انفَرَدَ عَنِ النّاسِ أنِسَ بِاللَّهِ سُبحانَهُ
hadiths.english: 4236. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He who secludes himself from people seeks company with Allah, Glory be to Him.’

hadiths.arabic: 4237. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَنِ اعتَزَلَ النّاسَ سَلِمَ مِن شَرِّهِم
hadiths.english: 4237. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘He who isolates himself from people is safe from their evil.’

sections.section_title_en: THAT WHICH DRIVES ONE TO SOLITUDE

hadiths.arabic: 4238. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام - لَمّا سُئلَ عَن عِلَّةِ اعتِزالِه - : فَسَدَ الزَّمانُ وتَغَيَّرَ الإخوانُ ، فرَأيتُ الانفِرادَ أسكَنَ لِلفُؤادِ
hadiths.english: 4238. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) was once asked the reason for his solitude away from people, to which he replied, ‘Times have become corrupt and brothers have changed, so I found solitude to be most calming for the heart.’

hadiths.arabic: 4239. الإمامُ العسكريُّ عليه السلام : الوَحشَةُ مِنَ النّاسِ عَلى‏ قَدرِ الفِطنَةِ بِهِم
hadiths.english: 4239. Imam al-Askari (AS) said, ‘Estrangement from people comes about as a direct result of knowing them too well.’

sections.section_title_en: ONE WHO MUST NOT ADOPT SOLITUDE

hadiths.arabic: 4240. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : المُؤمِنُ الّذي يُخالِطُ النّاسَ ويَصبِرُ عَلى‏ أذاهُم أفضَلُ مِنَ المُؤمِنِ الّذي لا يُخالِطُ النّاسَ ولا يَصبِرُ عَلى‏ أذاهُم
hadiths.english: 4240. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘The believer who mingles with people and tolerates their wrongs is better than the believer who does not mingle with people and does not tolerate their wrongs.’

hadiths.arabic: 4241. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله - لِرَجُلٍ أرادَ الجَبَلَ لِيَتعَبَّدَ فيهِ - : لَصَبرُ أحَدِكُم ساعَةً عَلى‏ ما يَكرَهُ في بَعضِ مَواطِنِ الإسلامِ خَيرٌ مِن عِبادَتِهِ خالِياً أربَعينَ سَنَةً
hadiths.english: 4241. The Prophet (SAWA) said to a man who wished to live in the mountains to worship therein, ‘Indeed someone’s tolerance of what he despises in any part of the Islamic territory for one hour is better than his forty years of worship in isolation.’

sections.section_title_en: CONDOLING WITH ONE WHO IS GRIEF-STRICKEN

hadiths.arabic: 4242. رسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله : مَن عَزّى‏ مُصاباً كانَ لَهُ مِثلُ أجرِهِ
hadiths.english: 4242. The Prophet (SAWA) said, ‘Whoever condoles with a grief-stricken person receives the same reward as him.’

hadiths.arabic: 4243. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : مَن عَزَّى الثَّكلى‏ أظَلَّهُ اللَّهُ في ظِلِّ عَرشِهِ يَومَ لا ظِلَّ إلّا ظِلُّهُ
hadiths.english: 4243. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Whoever condoles with a mother bereaved of her child will be shaded by Allah by the shade of His Throne on the Day when no other shade will avail.’

hadiths.arabic: 4244. الإمامُ الصّادقُ عليه السلام : كَفاكَ مِنَ التَّعزِيَةِ بأن يَراكَ صاحِبُ المُصيبَةِ
hadiths.english: 4244. Imam al-Sadiq (AS) said, ‘The minimum condolence required of you is that the bereaved one sees you present.’

sections.section_title_en: WHAT TO SAY WHEN GIVING CONDOLENCES TO A GRIEF-STRICKEN PERSON

hadiths.arabic: 4245. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : كانَ رَسولُ اللَّهِ صلى اللَّه عليه وآله إذا عَزّى‏ قالَ : آجَرَكُمُ اللَّهُ ورَحِمَكُم ، وإذا هَنَّأ قالَ : بارَكَ اللَّهُ لَكُم وبارَكَ عَلَيكُم
hadiths.english: 4245. Imam Ali (AS) narrated that when the Prophet (SAWA) gave condolences, he would say, ‘May Allah recompense you and have mercy on you’, and that when he gave congratulations, he would say, ‘May Allah bless you and send blessings on you.’

sections.section_title_en: CONGRATULATING THE GRIEF-STRICKEN IS MORE APPROPRIATE THAN CONDOLING HIM

hadiths.arabic: 4246. الإمامُ الرِّضا عليه السلام - في تَعزِيَتِهِ لِلحَسَنِ بنِ سَهلٍ - : التَّهنِئَةُ بِآجِلِ الثَّوابِ أولى‏ مِن التَّعزِيَةِ عَلى‏ عاجِلِ المُصيبَةِ
hadiths.english: 4246. Imam al-Rida (AS) said, when giving condolences to al-Hasan b. Sahl, ‘Congratulating someone for the reward that is in store for them is more appropriate than condoling them for a transient affliction.’

sections.section_title_en: The Etiquette of Social Interaction WITH PEOPLE

hadiths.arabic: 4247. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام : خالِطوا النّاسَ مُخالَطَةً إن مِتُّم مَعَها بَكَوا عَلَيكُم ، وإن عِشتُم (غِبتُم) حَنُّوا إلَيكُم
hadiths.english: 4247. Imam Ali (AS) said, ‘Mingle amongst people in such a way that when you die they should weep for you, and when you are alive, they should long for you.’

hadiths.arabic: 4248. الإمامُ عليٌّ عليه السلام - كانَ يَقولُ - : لِيَجتَمِعْ في قَلبِكَ الافتِقارُ إلَى النّاسِ ، والاستِغناءُ عَنهُم، يَكونُ افتِقارُكَ‏إلَيهِم في لينِ كَلامِكَ وحُسنِ بِشرِكَ، ويَكونُ استِغناؤكَ عَنهُم في نَزاهَةِ عِرضِكَ وبَقاءِ عِزِّكَ
hadiths.english: 4248.
